reviews.title: abbievt's review of Sherlock Holmes: The Devil's Daughter

reviewText.content: Had good graphics and a decent gameplay style. I particularly liked the "lab" aspects but I wish they had included more of it in the game. The plot was usually fairly easy to follow but there are points where they include things that aren't necessarily related to the game or just straight don't make sense. I liked the ability to see whether you had made the right deduction at the end of a chapter, I kind of wish they had added a link to your decisions further in the game. Not anything big like it completely changing the outcome of further chapters but maybe the other characters being mentioned or something, I'm not sure but it would have added a nice little touch to it. Puzzles were fairly good, not too easy and not too hard. The very end section confused me for some reason, I think because I couldn't work out if this was a dream segment or really happening. Character development was well balanced, not too much or too little. There were some timed actions in the game, not many, but some of them had quite strange animation going on. Overall, preferred Testament of Sherlock Holmes but this is still pretty good, still need to go back and finish all the steam achievements.

reviews.title: THE BEST GAME THAT I PLAYED EVER

reviewText.content:
This game is pure art it has a absolute beautiful history and the characters are amazing (specially neneko).
This game gave me happiness like no one other game gave me in a longer time! (neneko made me happy)
This game is incredible and I love it (love neneko)
AMAZING GAME

I really liked this metroidvania with retro-aesthatics. 
The game is set in a large interconnected tower which you will gradually ascend as you acquire new abilities. You also unlock elevators as you progress to allow you to fast-travel.
The game's main gimmick is that you control on of three characters, each with their own separate abilities that you need to progress. To switch you have to go to a campsite. This works well for the early parts and you need to decide which character you need for the challenges ahead. However, it can get tedious if you find yourself in a dead-end and you know you have to go back to the last campsite and back again. I would have preferred if a certain item was obtainable a little earlier.
If you die 
The items and abilities you can find are varied. Some are mandatory, some are optional.
There are also differently colored keys that you need to open some doors. Silver keys are needed to progress, blue keys open up optional areas and red keys open up segments to powerful items or bosses.
There is also a very light roguelite element: 
If you die, you can purchase permanent upgrades for each character. Then you are sent back to the base of the tower. 
This makes you stronger after each death, but oftentimes you have to backtrack relatively far to the point that you died, even with the elevators. And you cannot heal, not even really at campsites (you stock up the ability to heal once per boss you beat, but if you use it, it is gone forever). There are some movement upgrades, but many rooms are designed in a way that make backtracking slow.
While backtracking may be slow, in general the level design is really good. With areas looping around on themselves and then opening up small shortcuts.
Also, one specific character is much more powerful in terms of DPS, so it is a wise idea to invest your upgrades in him.

Little Nightmares was such a beautiful game with plenty of scares and an interesting story. Following along with Six as she goes through this weird place out on the water with all sorts of horrific monsters on board. Definitely a good game for anyone interested in a good horror-y experience

Me emocionaba mucho poder jugar este juego, tenía muchas ganas de jugarlo ya que me compre una nueva laptop que si podría correrlo, aunque quería empezar por el 2 pero me recomendaron jugar primero el 1, así que eso fue lo que hice.

Es un juego con un arte oscuro bastante original, me gustan mucho sus monstruos y toda la temática y el estilo, me gusta mucho la historia y la jugabilidad, creo que en el juego original es bastante intuitivo y fácil de entender, así que lo jugué sin mucha complicación, haciendo los puzles, apreciando el arte y de vez en cuando llevándome un susto. Y todo bien, la verdad es que me gustó mucho… Pero… Todo cambió cuando decidí jugar el DLC, el estilo del juego es el mismo, arte maravilloso y oscuro, pero la jugabilidad… no me gustó, tuve que buscar guías para poder pasármelo, era muy dificil para mí y considero que no soy tan mala en los videojuegos, pero no sé qué pasó, que hasta lo dejaba por periodos de tiempo muy largos y luego volvía y ya no sabía que es lo que tenía que hacer… Realmente llegué a enojarme mucho porque no podía pasarme ese boss o no sabía que hacer en ese lugar, me frustraba mucho.

Al final tengo que puntuarlos, y si solo puntuara al juego solo sin tener en cuenta al DLC probablemente tendría un 8. Pero voy a puntuarlos a ambos en conjunto…

Música/Audio: 6.5/10
Arte: 8.5/10
Historia: 7/10
Personajes: 5/10
Gameplay: 6/10

Pd: La historia estuvo muy buena y me encantó como el dlc está conectado al juego original, y el final… triste final…
Little Nightmares has gorgeous art style, atmosphere, and concept. However, the 2.5D levels can sometimes be deceptive, and controls could be more responsive.

I really liked it. The atmosphere is absolutely nailed, few games give you the feeling that this one does. I like that games don't spoon-feed you the story and make you think about it, and this game does it spectacularly. The story isn't told through documents, narrators, or characters; it's purely environmental storytelling  and it's up to you to pay attention to them to understand what's happening, which I love. 
Gameplay-wise, it's very simple, nothing special. No combat which is a good thing cause it makes you feel helpless. There are several fairly easy puzzles, but really good nonetheless. The enemies are really scary, they're deformed people who basically play cat and mouse with you. Each one has its own peculiarity, one is blind but has sharp hearing, another is weak against its own reflection, and so on. These weaknesses are visually shown, but their strengths are very well implemented. For example, with the blind enemy, the floor is made of boards that make noise, but there are carpets where you don't make noise, and the first time it hears you is when you step on a loose board. From that first moment I knew I was gonna love the game. 
The DLC ''Secrets of the Maw'' is cool, it's about 3 hours long and very well done, where they add new enemies and other areas with new mechanics. The final area gave me Resident Evil vibes. 
All and all, props to the team. Really good game.
An incredible game like arkham city, but better. In this game you can control the batmobile and the other characters like nightwing, robin, catwoman, azrael and harley queen.

Arkham Knight is a gem: its storytelling, side missions, characters, combat, plot are all incredible. A step-up from the previous games, Arkham Knight incorporates elements missing from Asylum, City, & Origins (such as finally incentivizing doing side missions), and makes them fun and engaging. Using the bat-mobile is hard getting used to at first, and you really have to get good to progress the story, otherwise the game will be unforgiving. Along with Marvel's Spider-man, this is one of the best superhero video games of all time. Deciding which one's better is up to everyone.

reviews.title: spicygamethunder's review of Batman: Arkham Knight

reviewText.content:
TL,DR:
The finale of the Rocksteady's Arkham trilogy, Arkham Knight had some horrible PC issues at launch that have been resolved. Looks amazing even now, runs really well with a lot of content even if the main villain is a little bland. Don't use the bat-mobile like it's Burnout Paradise and you'll be fine.

Full Review:
Halloween night falls upon Gotham City nine months since the events of Arkham City, and the peace that Batman has worked to maintain has been shattered to pieces by Scarecrow. His deployment of Fear Gas has pushed the city to evacuate its citizens and forces what's left of GCPD to struggle to maintain order as Scarecrow works to cripple the city and unmask Batman. Of course Scarecrow isn't alone and the playing field has changed with the appearance of the Arkham Knight, a new adversary with a private military force at his disposal with a grudge to see Batman suffer. The other villains won't sit idly by and have their own plans for Gotham even after the events of Arkham City, with moments that will leave Batman to question his sanity.

Rocksteady does a great job of using the generational leap to really let this rouges gallery shine to spectacular effect. Facial animation is really well done in cut-scenes and main character models have an incredible amount of detail. The cities districts and other locations each feel like they have a personality more than ever with places like Panessa Studios, referencing the eras of cinema in Gotham City to the mix of high-tech and noir influences in the GCPD Building, you'll be hard-pressed to find a location that doesn't feel hand-crafted on an expert level.

Jumping right in, the combat system will be instantly familiar for anyone who's played the other Arkham games. As always, the right timing and variety in your combos will go a long way in gaining experience points. The predator system hasn't really changed too much with more variety going into take-down options. These can really turn the tide on higher difficulty so plan wisely.

The biggest addition here is the Batmobile, the driving mode is what you'd expect but handles well and has a look that sort of between The Tumbler from The Dark Knight & The Batmobile from Superman vs Batman. The more controversial 2nd mode changes things up a lot, you can transition to its combat mode at will which controls sort of like a nimble tank. Some players took issue with it and I think it's because they think it should control like Need for Speed rather than its own thing. One thing to mention is that the combat encounters for the Bat-tank can happen a little too frequent at times, switching between main story and side activities can help alleviate that.

Side content varies depending on what you find interesting, the side villains are the highlight with unique environments, stories, & combat scenarios. They'll also have different dialog depending on when you do them, especially if you save them after completing the endgame. You'll of course have the Riddler trophies to get with varying degrees of challenge, AR missions for Bat-tank, & some racing missions that all help to give the impression that the city is one giant puzzle.

Enemies are what you'd expect depending on which villain you're facing off. Much like Arkham City, most of them are largely the same early on with costume or different melee weapon changes that reflect their faction. Henchmen AI has been improved on higher difficulties so think fast and plan accordingly if you're looking for a real challenge.

Batman: Arkham Knight had a terrible PC launch with performance issues across the board and WB having to take over to clean up the port by Iron Galaxy. Fast forward over 5 years later and things couldn't be better with Rocksteady recently patching out the WBPlay account system & Denuvo DRM. With a relatively decent GPU, it looks fantastic and is well optimized short of a few dated NVIDIA features. Feel free to use the in-game benchmark to see what works for your system.

I'll also mention that there is a fairly long comic book tie-in series that's actually pretty good as well as an animated movie. I wouldn't say these are a requirement but they do add to the backstory which can feel a bit lacking in certain moments. The season pass also does a decent job of it but I'll save my thoughts on that in a separate review.

It's a great time to jump into the finale of the Arkham trilogy. Some might find the controls of the Bat-Tank to be divisive but you get used to it quickly enough, just don't treat it like Burnout and you'll be fine. I also don't think the Arkham Knight ends up being the best antagonist, YMMV on how familiar you are with other Batman material. This Dark Knight returns to rise above even a lot of games that come out today, Batman: Arkham Knight sees the trilogy off with a bang and is well worth your time.

Отличный тактический шутер в серии Star Wars. Нам дают под управление одного коммандос и еще трех напарников. Я не просто так сказал "тактический шутер", так как мы играем за главного в отряде, то соответственно  и команды можем давать другим коммандос. Жаль, что спектр команд мал, мы можем дать указание: вылечиться, занять позицию, установить заряд, взломать, занять позицию, найти и уничтожить, перегруппироваться. Ну, в принципе этого хватает, правда все же в большинстве случаев все равно придется действовать самому, потому как ИИ тут немного туповат. Первый плюс - тактическая составляющая игры, ее я уже описал выше. Второй плюс - коммандос, за всю игру к ним привязываешься и хочется еще чего то, но кроме этой и мобильной игры больше ничего с их участием не сделали.

Good noir detective story. Simple clean graphics, I like the style. Could use voice acting, but I don't mind reading so it's not a big deal for me. And the music was nice, pleasant and not overwhelming.
I hope it gets a sequel! :D

good concept not executed that well. the music and look of the game is great but the gameplay didnt hold up. It had the worst elements  of point and clicks, where to solve the puzzle you have to connect seemingly random things through trial and error. it made the game frustrating and i didnt get much satisfaction from beating it in the end. that said its aesthetic carries it well and its a fun short noir mystery story.

6,5/10
Don’t be scared by the screenshots, essentially this is a 3D walking sim with the ability to examine very detailed models, but for the most part there is no point in it, other than reading a huge number of notes and other things, no “pixel hunting” or looking for a box somewhere under the sofa, not even a sit button,

In 2D only our hands (which is ok), and conversations with our mother, which is already “doubtful, but ok”, essentially like in the novel, the characters do not have lip movements when speaking, , the characters do not have lip movements when speaking, but there are animations of gestures and emotions, but they are repeated too often, the main character is pleasant, but I couldn’t really get into it due to the lack of animations, the story itself is cute, but the banal “everyday humdrum”: t to whom the grandmother cheated or she did not cheat, who is the real father in that spirit, there is an opportunity to speed up replicas, but then the game will take about 2 hours to complete, with all the secrets in about 3 hours.
Music/Ambient is so quiet that it’s even depressing, some items can be taken with you and they will appear somewhere in the glove compartment of the car, , there are a couple of optional dialogues with a friend on a push-button phone and a couple of dialogues depending on your presses, which may make you smile, the atmosphere of the trip is not even close to "Road 96", the game failed to create its own atmosphere at all, just a cute short novel with 3D scenery, alas, I expected more, I really love mixing styles and I like the "Annapurna Interactive" games, but lately they are not surprised.

Check my Annapurna Top: https://www.backloggd.com/u/grihajedy/list/publisher-annapurna-interactive/
//
Не пугайтесь скриншотов, по сути это 3D-симулятор ходьбы с возможностью осматривать очень детализированные модельки, но в большинстве в этом нету никакого смысла, кроме чтения огромного кол-ва записей и прочего, никакого "пиксельхантинга" и поиска коробочки где-нибудь под диваном тут нету, даже кнопки приседания нет,

в 2D сделаны только наши руки (что окээй), и разговоры с нашей мамой, что уже "сомнительно, но окээй", по сути как в новелле, у персонажей нет движения губ при репликах, но зато есть анимации жестикуляции и эмоций, но они слишком часто повторяются, главная героиня приятная, но особо проникнуться из-за нехватки анимаций я не смог, сама история мило заканчивается, но банальная "бытовуха": что там кому бабушка изменяла или не изменяла кто реальный отец вот в этом духе, есть возможность проматывать реплики, но тогда игра будет проходиться вообще часа за 2, c просмотром всего и всеми секретами около 3.
Музыка/Ambient настолько тихие, что даже угнетают, некоторые предметы можно забирать с собой и они появятся где-нибудь в бардачке машины, есть пара опциональных диалогов с подружкой по кнопочному телефону и пару диалогов, зависящех от ваших нажатий, которые могут улыбнуть, но не буду спойлерить, атмосфера поездки и близко не "Road 96", вообще особой атмосферы никакой не получилось, просто милая новелла с 3д декорациями, увы, ожидал большего, я так то люблю смешение стией и люблю игры "Annapurna Interactive", но в последнее время мало удивляют.

Open Roads took me on an emotional journey, unraveling family secrets alongside Tess and Opal. While the story resonated with me and the voice acting was superb, the short length left me wanting more. The beautiful hand-drawn art style was a highlight, but the lack of gameplay depth was a bit disappointing. Overall, it was a touching experience, but one that ended too soon.

[16-19 Dec 22. Finished all three routes, but didn't manage to complete them. As in, I stopped before battling the Elite Four, Arven, and Cassiopeia.] I've been a fan of the series since the 3rd generation and although the more recent releases (like Sword and Shield) were disappointments, I had high hopes for this one given that Legends: Arceus was a total banger. Unfortunately, it appears GameFreak learned nothing from the success that is Legends: Arceus. SV had all the makings of a great Pokemon game but it fell so, so, so short.

Há anos os responsáveis ​​pela franquia Pokémon vêm prometendo um jogo de mundo aberto, e nossa expectativa é um jogo que realmente surpreenda e atenda nossos desejos, foi então que aprendi com Pokémon Violet que a vida é feita de escolhas, e hoje temos esse jogo dos sonhos, mas qual foi o preço?

Pokémon Violet traz um elenco mais concentrado, com histórias antológicas, e preocupações que, para mim, não são tão fáceis de se acreditar, mas mesmo assim imersivas. O jogo permite você criar relações sinceras entre os personagens, muito mais em especial com o seu parceiro Pokémon Miraidon.

O suspense está a todo vapor em Pokémon Violet, várias vezes me peguei desconfiado de alguém, ou intrigado com as ações dos outros, e embora algumas histórias se sobreponham em cima de outras, por puro interesse, eu queria e sabia que o desfecho delas seria realmente deslumbrante.

As complexidades dos mapas que a gamefreak cria são pontos que realmente me surpreenderam, e os biomas são muito bem conectados, você vê a transição natural quando sai de uma área com muita lama para uma área mais verde, e vê os pokémon vivendo de forma selvagem, o que é uma adição muito bonita e valiosa.

De antemão, Pokémon Violet tem SIM problemas de performance, como FPS e bugs chatos que afetam a jogabilidade, mas aqui vou tratar de gráficos e bugs gráficos, ou seja, o contexto visual da coisa. E com isso, garanto, Pokémon teve um upgrade maravilhoso em relação a Sword & Shield.

E para começar por eles, vamos falar dos Pokémon. A maioria deles estão bem polidos, trabalhados e traz fidelidade em seus comportamentos. Suas texturas também seguem sua biologia, no entanto, Pokémon que não possuem pelos ou escamas às vezes parecem ser feitos de plástico.

A renderização no Nintendo Switch também é algo que me preocupa bastante, pois além dos Pokémon simplesmente aparecerem na sua tela, alguns aparecem com gráficos quadrados que com o tempo vão se ajustando e tomando sua forma original, e isso é algo que me tira momentaneamente da imersão.

Quando se trata da trilha sonora de Pokémon, confesso que facilmente me empolgo. Nesse tema, o cuidado é outro. Em Pokémon Violet tudo tem seu próprio tema, e muitos deles são extremamente divertidos e com contexto, e embora não supere Sword & Shield, vários temas são dignos de playlist.

Já que a trilha sonora traz tanta emoção, por outro lado os efeitos sonoros são um recurso pecaminoso, já que os ataques dos Pokémon são compostos por sons de explosão e estrondos genéricos, e os menus são uma sinfonia barata cheia de "Plims" e "Plams". Apenas o som de "check" da Pokébola salva nesse quesito.

E por fim, a falta de dublagem, pelo menos em cenas épicas, é um grande mistério para os jogos Pokémon, e com Pokémon Masters Ex já apresentando esse recurso, torna injustificável a falta de dublagem e voz dos personagens, e assim, é sério que temos mais uma cena de música escrita em uma caixa de diálogo?

O mundo aberto de Pokémon de fato traz uma experiência completamente nova e fascinante, você se distrai muito facilmente em suas explorações, e isso é ótimo, pois é divertido explorar a região de Paldea, são muitas descobertas atrás de descobertas de um mundo completamente rico e lindo.

Quem já jogou Pokémon Legends Arceus sabe bem que jogar Pokémon Violet é praticamente voltar à sua rotina de batalhas lentas e complexas, mas ainda com comandos de interface semelhantes. Para quem está vindo diretamente de Sword & Shield, poderá notar um grande avanço na Qualidade de Vida do jogo.

E bem diferente de seus antecessores, Pokémon Violet finalmente separa jogadores competitivos de jogadores casuais e Shiny Hunts, o jogo propõe desafios sólidos para todos e você apenas escolhe como quer viver em Paldea, pois o jogo possui conteúdo para mais de 200 horas de jogabilidade casual.

You are sent to investigate a lonely roadside diner that has lost its color.  Your mission is to restore the colors by solving various puzzles while uncovering a mystery as to why the colors disappeared in the first place.  What is the mystery of Discolored?

Good question.  I did not uncover any deeper secrets or discover why the colors disappeared in the first place.  This is frustrating as the About This Game section on the Storepage hinted at “discovering deeper secrets” and, sadly, Discolored didn’t deliver.

What is this game then?  Discolored is a surreal, beautifully crafted, and well-thought out ‘Find and Solve’ game that the developer obviously put his heart and soul into.  It is a good game but I would have liked to have learned more about the world: who I am, why I am finding colors of this strange diner, and what is going on.  Sadly, Discolored doesn’t offer any clues (unless I totally missed them, which is possible).  Additionally, the beginning and end of Discolored were confusing for an already perplexing game story wise.

Discolored, overall, was interesting but I wasn’t overly impressed with the game.  There are some great points, however.  Beautifully crafted visuals were simple in nature but good, the sound was on par with the game, the music was nice, the gameplay simple to pick up, and the puzzles were fine and made for an enjoyable, albeit short, game.  But in the end it was the lack of story, or explanation of the story, that made the game fall short in my opinion.

Will there be a next chapter to Discolored?  Will it explain more about the world and you as the protagonist?  I hope so…I really do.  I recommend Discolored for people who enjoy the ‘Find and Solve’ style games but would recommend that you get it on sale as the full price is a little steep for a one to two-hour game.

Fairly fun game, it sticks to a simple idea and develops it as much as it's humanly possible. The story is a bit naive and generic, but at least it doesn't seem pretentious. It has a bit of humor here and there and doesn't take itself too seriously. The reason you're going to play this game is the combat, and it is very enjoyable until the very end. Level design gets more and more absurd (in a good way) as you progress, keeping gameplay relatively fresh, along with new enemies that play differently. Only disappointment was that towards the end it took too long between checkpoints, adding to the difficulty because it allows zero mistakes for a long period, instead of actually difficult combat.

Going to play Gunbird 2 for nostalgic reasons; I was really surprised how beginner friendly this game can be. Like don't get me wrong, it has challenging issues, but the initial start of the game wasn't nearly as off putting as some other shmups out there. Gunbird 2 has a tendency to shift between it's first few stages giving players a chance to become more familiar with it's levels. The way that you lose power ups is gradual as it's not all at once, and the enemy attacks do have some predictable patterns once you get use to them. All in all, Gunbird 2 is at least friendly in the beginning, which makes for the last 2 levels spike in difficulty really exasperating.

Honestly, I think that's just the main problem with Gunbird 2 here. No matter how much you pay attention it can always feel like a bomb didn't go off fast enough or an attack came out way too fast. And really this is only noticeable near the end of the game, at Gunbird 2's last two levels that things feel unfair. Why there is suddenly a laser that can instantly come out, or the way certain enemies and attack patterns start attacking from the sides really feels more jarring than challenging. No enemies are introduced before hand that are like this, and the game sort requires you know when a boss is just going to fire a laser with little warning. It just makes getting to the end point, only to game over feel awful, or simply dying in these last few levels a hellish nightmare of survival that feels like there is no way out.

This was such an intriguing and interesting concept to me, of wannabe celebrities being trapped in a studio with a killer among them, because I'm a huge Agatha Christie fan and I love K-stan culture. Played the game's first route on 22 Feb 22, but haven't tried out the other routes yet.

Florence is an ephemeral, but utterly unforgettable visual novel/interactive story; an intimate portrait of a relationship where each chapter represents a stage in a couple's journey together. From those initial sparks of infatuation filled with giddy anxiety and anticipation, to arguments filled with angry outbursts and subsequent feelings of regret.

Each of these snapshots is accompanied with simple, but smart gameplay elements that enhance and elevate rather than detract from the themes at play in each scene. For example, dialogue is represented as puzzle pieces throughout the course of the game; during the first date section, each dialogue bubble has 4-5 pieces, since the characters are still getting to know each other. Later on however, as the relationship develops, these puzzles become easier, with only 2 or 3 pieces per puzzle. It's such a brilliantly intuitive way to communicate such a complex idea, and the game is absolutely full of similarly magical moments just as this one.

If Florence has any shortcomings, it's that it's not particularly replayable; it doesn't have any secrets to uncover, and it doesn't have multiple endings to unlock, but what it lacks here, it makes up for in attention to detail. There are multiple points where you're able to add your own personal touches that will eventually weave their way into the background of the narrative, and it's things like that really make the game's emotional impact all the more stunning to experience.

Florence serves as a reminder that simplicity in game design doesn't automatically equate to a shallow experience, and it's a rare case amidst the visual novel genre where the gameplay is anything but vestigial in nature. It simply would not work as well as it does without that interactive element to the storytelling.

A lovely, emotional, one of a kind masterpiece.
10/10.
çizimleri, müzikleri, hikayesi muhteşem oyun. tekrar tekrar film gibi açılıp oynanr.

Beaucoup de poésie, une très belle direction artistique, des puzzles et interactions sans difficulté.
L'histoire est joliment racontée, avec une sobriété narrative.
Petit jeu de détente très court (1 heure), à acheter en promo (1-2 euros).
Pour les amateurs du genre, ne pas hésiter !

reviews.title: A mobile game that's actually good

reviewText.content: The game centers on Florence Yeoh, a young woman on a journey of love and self-discovery. Through a series of interactive vignettes, players engage with Florence's life in ways that are both simple and profound. The touch-based gameplay is intuitive, allowing players to interact with the story in a way that feels deeply personal. Each action—whether it's piecing together a conversation or navigating a memory—mirrors the emotional beats of Florence’s experiences, drawing players into her world. The minimalist art style and evocative music further enhance the narrative, creating a cohesive and immersive experience.

𝟖/𝟏𝟎 𝐓𝐫𝐮𝐞 𝐰𝐨𝐫𝐤 𝐨𝐟 𝐚𝐫𝐭!
Although it is a banal shooting range for speed,
But, the music makes this experience unforgettable and infinitely replayable, I respect the composer, this "inducing" motive, which, after passing the middle of the game, becomes generally mad - it's incredible.
The plot here, most likely, is about a drug addict who is trying not to die and get out of the "binge", and, of course, there is not enough full-fledged story up to 10/10, but you can imagine any story convenient for you in your head, where the main character needs to run until the end and not die. Another flaw of the game for me is not very well-developed shooting, I completed game with a shotgun, it's much easier, but the "aim-challenge" is losted.
Well, I can also say that sometimes quite beautiful locations are generated, all the sounds are of high quality.
And yet, the game is quite easy, in fact, it takes 4-7 hours to complete, even if you don’t know how to shoot (again, shotgun helps you), lacks some kind of hardcore mode, but it would be even better to get the second part)

reviews.title: Petit jeu (français) basé sur le roman

reviewText.content:
Petit jeu (français) basé sur le roman : librement inspiré il reste tout de même tout à fait dans l'état d'esprit de l'oeuvre d'origine.
Les décors peints sont très beaux et très bien mis en valeurs à travers l'animation du jeu.
On reste ici sur un jeu narratif simple, entre novel story et walking simulateur.
L'histoire est linéaire, avec plusieurs fins possibles, suivant des choix d'action.

+ Joliment dessiné et animé
+ Durée de vie correcte vu le prix (~10h)
+ Le gameplay n'évolue quasiment pas, mais la diversité des situations fait que l'intérêt est renouvelé
+ Bon travail global pour une petite équipe
~ Le côté musical aurait pu être plus exploité, comme sur "Inside My Radio" par exemple

A very short game, good effort, and a brilliant idea. I highly recommend to finish in one sitting (so you don't forget what decisions you made), make your assumptions and based on that, progress through the game. Play with purpose, and you will enjoy playing, or even re-playing the game. Keep in mind that this make-your-own-adventure style is not for everyone.

PlateUp! is an interesting way to bring a blend of Overcooked, restaurant simulation, and the roguelite genre together. It plays exactly like it sounds. I am not a fan of stressful coop gaming, so I can't really say I enjoyed the experience. That being said, if you are a fan of any of the genres described above and you have someone to play with, this might be a game just for you.
Its an amazing game you can link twitch chat to it and your viewers can joining the fu

Inicio de juego: 13/09/23
Fin del juego: 14/09/23

La primera mitad ha sido un poco lenta y no conecté mucho con los personajes así como tampoco entendía nada de lo que estaba pasando, simplemente avanzaba y deseaba que la niña dejara de hablar. Sin embargo la segunda mitad mejoró bastante, la historia tomó sentido y estuvo interesante al punto de que queríamos saber que ocurriría. 

Al final me decepcionó un poco saber que no había otro final por otras decisiones, pero entendí que era el juego, o el "narrador" quién jugaba con nosotros.

Musica:   8/10
Arte: 9.5/10
Historia: 7.5/10
Personajes: 6.5
Gameplay: 5

Il s'agit ici d'une aventure narrative, avec un peu d'exploration d'environnement et des choix narratifs à effectuer, influençant (légèrement) l'histoire et sa fin.
Donc pas de ramassage d'objet à reprendre de son inventaire voire à combiner.
Attention (bis) à l'aspect mignon, comme pour Sam'n Max hit the road on a affaire à un humour noir destiné aux adultes ; le côté mignon de notre petite Lady vient justement faire contraste avec son histoire et l'aventure.
Le point fort du jeu est clairement son écriture, un délice, et le doublage anglais d'excellente facture (sous titres fr bien présents).
Jeu assez court (3-4h) donc à prendre à 10 euros max.

Joué sur SeriesX.

7/10
(2-hour review)

To begin with, I replaying the first part before the sequel and didn’t “see” anything remarkable in the game, I don’t understand the hype around it, it’s just an indie with good destructibility and buggy and not buggy physics), it was difficult to even call it a full-fledged game, although DLC for it were already more interesting, as they tried to parody popular genres of games, this made more sense. In general, I do not recommend the original part,

But the sequel can already be recommended, well .. for a very specific audience. This is the same Goat simulator.. only normally designed, now we have Unreal engine graphics and physics, a pretty visual/interface, a more interesting location of the city in the mountains, for completing tasks you recieve new clothes for customizing your goat, there are activities for multiplayer, although very primitive, and you can drive cars) And even the control is nice. More or less normal optimization. And now.. I can’t say that this is a bad and pointless game, but it’s also not necessary to play it.. I liked more the 2021 game from some developers of Goat Simulator in the same genre of sandbox or "entertain yourself" - "Just Die Already" , there was an interesting city, at least a little lively, cartoonish visual, interesting secrets, at least some goal that could be called the final of game, the concept itself - when you play as a fragile grandfather and can "dismember" into pieces from any hit/touch - really created a unique "sandbox" experience, and it also gave you some kind of hardcore.
But in the "Goat" game, jumping on some skyscrapers, for the sake of secrets, on the contrary, infuriates, it's easier to just run around and smash everything around into chips with your horns, but it will quickly get boring. Interesting Easter eggs i also didn`t met, except for a simple mangling of famous names, but it's boring. The game itself is trying to parody games in the open world, but in fact it`s the same, if you call "farm" useless - That doesn't stop a farm from being a farm) It would be better if the game deep more seriously into some specific "parody", like it was in dlc to the original, well, or at least.. Would add more reactions to people). They also added full-fledged missions, like helping someone or doing something, but in terms of gameplay, this is all also implemented as primitively as possible.

🏆 I only liked the joke at the end of the mini-game, when no matter who wins the round, you can be the first to reach the cup at the end and win). Yes, and the initial cutscene from the first person was made cool, I already thought that I was playing AAA about a goat, and, by the way, the price of the game, now, of course, is a very goaty.. in any region.

reviews.title: the_last_b's review of Long Live The Queen

reviewText.content: Generalmente creo que este juego me gustaría más en otro punto de mi vida, veo lo que intenta y me interesa, jugar probar varias rutas para llegar a lo mejor, optimizar según las decisiones e ir tomando notas para ver la ruta perfecta, pero lamentablemente no tengo el tiempo para dedicarle ahora mismo, volveré eventualmente porque veo porque seria genial, pero mi tiempo con el no fue bonito y ver muerte tras muerte luego de apartar tiempo para el fue desmotivante simplemente tendré que volver en unos años

reviews.title: the_gaming_archaeologist's review of Spirit Hunter: Death Mark

reviewText.content:
I can't believe I've not reviewed this...I think I was waiting to return to this game and get all the achievements. Something I only save for games that really inspire me to go 110% for them. I originally streamed this years ago and certainly didn't know what I was going to get with this!
First part of my stream: https://youtu.be/-aDXAHywnFs?si=a_uAnfR1cIHKfxzY

Now before continuing I'll get content warnings for this game out of the way for those that need them:
Sexual Abuse (referenced and suggestive imagery), gore (decapitations, blood, open wounds), body horror, Childhood Sexual Abuse (only written down and alluded to for first and DLC case) and that's all that comes to mind. I apologise if I missed any.

When I started this game up my assumption was that it would be a horror visual novel similar to others I had played in the past, being fairly typical and "middle of the road" in regards to horror (as there's only so much you can do with a VN, right?) however this would prove to be one of those that, like The Letter, has a lot of depth to it and can be really haunting. Even if you're the type not easily scared by horror or gore.
Unlike The Letter, this game doesn't have nearly as many branching paths, however, the choices in it were great and very fulfilling imo.

Story:
(It's been a while so bare with me...)
You play as someone who wakes up with amnesia and has a mysterious mark on your wrist. Soon you learn that it's a curse and when investigating a building that you feel a strange draw to and a clue about your curse you are greeted by a creepily human-like doll that's just sat there as if it were alive. The person you search for, turns out to be dead with flowers bursting from their stomach and before you can get any answers you meet a few strangers who were looking for the same person and needed help in their investigation of a haunted school.
The doll is actually alive and speaks to you about the curse, suggesting that they might be related somehow and you on on a adventure of tracking down these haunted locations and removing the spirits.

Gameplay:
As a VN you can imagine that there isn't too much here that you don't be expecting, that said, you are able to choose only one person to bring with you on these investigations and each one may give you a different insight or even have a skill to help with your investigation.
When you have a final showdown with the spirit, you have a selection of items to use that, when used, will create a different reaction and depending on what you do, you may either banish the spirit (effectively destroying the spirit and sending it to oblivion) or help them pass on (pacifying the spirit's rage, releasing everyone from it's curse and helping it pass to the other side) which in some cases were easy if you paid attention to who this ghost was, what happened in their life and, ultimately, how they became what they are now.

This adds more of a story aspect than real mechanical benefit from what I remember, but either ending is up to how you feel in regards to these lonely spirits who often ultimately died in a painful way that they didn't deserve. There are also timed sections where you need to make a choice or end up dead. A life-or-death situation where the wrong move can cost you your life which happens either due to the spirit finding you first before you are ready, a trap being set off or even attacked by a vicious/possessed animal. Again, the solutions are there if you look for them, however, not everyone will be able to identify them or even understand the order they need to be used in, but the save system is fairly generous so it isn't too bad. Again if memory serves.

The art is perfect in it's ability to portray images that evoke horror and fear. I wasn't too certain of it at the beginning, but I found myself really liking it. It's certainly not your typical brightly-coloured anime style and there is a lack of typical emotes like sweat drips and ect, however, this all just adds to the game. I don't think I could've taken these moments are seriously as I did when playing this if the art looked like, say, Hero Academia or Spy X Family. If anything, this is closer to Attack on Titan with it's use on dark colours that convey the seriousness of the series.

This is a really good horror VN that took me completely by surprise! I highly recommend it, but only if you can stomach through the content warnings mentioned earlier. They don't pull their punches in the topics of this game and it's all the more reason to play it!

reviewText.content:
Awesome climate :) Satifyingly hard and curious about what is hidden deeper!
Flying around in caves with laser and vacuumcleaner to gather resources. Many hidden items, caves, histories, weapons.
