After finishing the last level, I felt exhausted, but given the incentives to play again - whether for collecting gems, flashback tapes, or trying out the inverted levels - I started from the beginning. The second play-through is a much more enjoyable experience. However, if you are a completionist, this is going to be a real grind for you.

Nice little obscene 3D Platformer.
It has enough movement options, levels, collectibles to keep you engaged.
The levels are varied. In the beginning, the platforming is on the easy side and it is never brutally difficult. There are some platforming sequences that are challenging however.
The humour can be hit and miss, but the cutscenes are short enough if you don't like them.
It does not overstay its welcome, but has a decent length and unlockable skills.
Although some skills are not that useful, there are more than enough skillpoints to unlock all the skills.

Jack Jeanne completely swept me off my feet! The beautiful art style, captivating story, and well-developed characters had me fully invested in the world of Univeil. The rhythm game segments were a surprising but welcome addition, adding another layer of enjoyment to the experience. While some of the 3D models felt a bit out of place, it didn't detract from the overall charm of the game. It's a must-play for fans of visual novels and anyone looking for a heartwarming and engaging story.

I've only scratched the surface of this game, but I can already tell that it's meant to be played all-or-nothing. Either you have four players or you play it alone. Two or three player will result in your character swapping out automatically and never knowing quite where you on screen or who you're controlling. The graphics rule and mechanics are okay, but not amazing.

reviews.title: Belle réalisation mais histoire non développée

reviewText.content:
* Extrêmement beau et fluide, la réalisation graphique est excellente.
* Niveau animation rien à redire non plus, c'est hyper fluide, même avec du gros boss.
* La musique reste discrète mais joue bien son rôle 'zen' en nous laissant nous concentrer sur le jeu.
* Côté gameplay les personnages en eux-mêmes n'évoluent pas durant le jeu, mais il y a plein d'astuces qui viennent renouveler le gameplay, très bien pensé.
* La durée de vie est honnête, la difficulté bien dosée, sauf peut etre qq endroits où les checkpoints peuvent sembler éloignés (2 / 3 endroits dans le jeu, rien de dramatique, même si ca fait un peu rager des fois quand comme moi on a pas bcp de skill sur ce genre de jeu :p)
* Reste un point noir qui fait que le jeu sera vite oublié : il n'y a pas d'histoire. Passé l'intro sur les parchemins, plus rien à part une déesse que l'on voit trois fois pour des blagues pas drôles et vides. Dommage car il y avait certainement moyen de faire qq chose avec cette belle direction artistique !
* Pour finir le jeu est parfaitement jouable en solo, l'alternance des personnages est bien gérée, les personnages étant bien équilibrés avec leurs particularités (saut flottant ou double saut, etc.)

Joué sur SeriesX via le game pass (FPS Boost et HDR, le jeu juste au top !)

Petit jeu sympathique plein d'humour, on retrouve les classiques d'un jeu d'aventure avec son lot de quêtes, de PNJ, et d'équipements à débloquer au fil des boss.
D'une durée de vie d'une poignée d'heures, un bon moment sans prétention.

Joué sur SeriesX via le game pass.

reviews.title: The Letter A Horror Visual Novel

reviewText.content:
The Letter A Horror Visual Novel is a technically impressive novel that lacks in the story department. The character models, backgrounds, and voice acting all stand out. The characters are mostly well written. The story, however, is kind of dull and not super scary considering it's a "horror" novel. The pacing is also all over the place and not all endings are very satisfying. Worth a read though due to the characters.

Overall Score: 6/10

Genuinely one of the coolest games I've played in a while. The story is pretty simple, although it has its moments, both wholesome and scary, but the way the VN is structured, especially around the idea of 'consequences matter' is genuinely insane, with a massive flowchart and just really cool dichotomy between very different routes, such that playing the game in different ways can deal to very different versions of each character (This is especially notorious with the more contemptuous ones). About the characters themselves, they're really deep, at least most of them, and as the game allows you to play each one of them per chapter, it really helps you empathize with their issues and it enhances the way in which your actions affect other storylines. The minigames is one of the few things I'm not too happy about; they're very unnecessary and particularly annoying for the type of game this is. I like that you can skip them, however. That's good.

The game has a lot of moving parts and character endings that really offer an unique experience, excellent characters and a solid plot progression done through chapters that works real well, amazing art and bgm, and is just an excellent VN imo. Twas so worth it, this one.

One of massively underrated games. It has very similar story/problem as first The Longest Journey - many players somehow missed the game and those who hadn't, were not able to understand the story or haven't seen potential and/or timelessness of the game.

A Beautfully funny follow up to Stick It To The Man
Zoink does it again!

++ Direction artistique superbe, et toujours très fluide (moteur Unity)
+ Bonne durée de vie pour le prix
+ Doublage VO excellent
+ Personnes originaux et hauts en couleurs
~ Pas vraiment de difficulté, les énigmes sont très simples et plutôt des prétextes pour guider dans la trame narrative
~ Les sauvegardes en cours de chapitre sont partielles, mieux vaut finir un chapitre avant de quitter le jeu
- Des petits problèmes ponctuels de grésillement de son et désynchro des sous titres Fr, peut être lié à mon PC. Ou pas.
-- Histoire découpée en différents chapitres, mais sans gros rebondissement ni personnages très approfondis, loin d'un Grim Fandango en terme d'écriture si on reste sur la thématique :) Même dans plusieurs années je ne pense pas refaire le jeu, contrairement à un DoTT ou GF justement.

Donc un bon jeu à petit prix, soigné mais pas inoubliable :)

I love games where a character is thrown into the world, and you have to use your detective powers to figure out a way forward. Smile for Me is a small game, so you kind of have to do everything in a very specific way to progress, and eventually beat it. If you compare this to, for example, Paradise Killer, or Forgotten City, Smile for Me is a similar game, but it's size prevents it from being great.

Sometimes you stumble onto a piece of gaming that just.. works. Untitled Goose isn't anything revolutionary but it nontheless managed to deliver something i haven't expeirenced in a long time: just pure pleasure. It's clever, fun, refreshing, well spirited and uplifintg. I dare anyone to play this and not find themselves smiling at your goose mischief :)

What a honking great game!

Untitled Goose Game is an environmental puzzle game in which you play as a goose. It got a lot of attention, because you play as a goose. However, the gameplay is a bit frustrating. This is because puzzles only have one solution and there is no feedback, which means that you end up endlessly messing around until you get it right. Another issue that I encountered quite often, is that you have to wrestle with the npc for the game to do what you want; it's really not as fluent as I would like.
This might be the most FUN I've had playing a game. It's very good at making me happy and letting me vent my internal chaotic goose.

it's a wonderful game, interesting mechanics, the design makes the game more beautiful, the soundtrack is interactive with the events of the game, the characters seem to be real people, but there are still some bugs that can happen in the middle of the game, but generally are for one object in the scenario to enter another but just restart the save and the problem is solved

Jeu sympathique qui donne droit à qq heures d'énigmes plus ou moins tordues.
Rien de foufou et durée de vie relativement courte et suffisante, mais très original :)

(joué SeriesX via le game pass)
Fun puzzles with an engaging story, although a bit short (completed in 5 hours). If you like games like Portal and The Talos Principle, you'll probably like The Turing Test as well.
way too tedious and slow for my taste. almost put a bullet in my head playing the INTRO...definitely a great game for those into this type of thing, but not for me. not one bit.
Unique. It's rare to see a truly innovative city builder. The last time I had a similar feeling was when Frostpunk was released. A must-play if you're into city-building games.

Don't get it twisted, this is a full-on simulator aimed to replicate the exact experience of playing pinball in real life. I spent a few hours on this game, before it got repetitive for me, though, being only a casual player. The challenges are all the same on each table, lots of tables are behind the DLC wall, and if you are not interested in multiplayer, this is kind of it. You run out of tables eventually, and challenges become stale.
Game killed by essentially impossible to play on mouse and keyboard.

Niveau réalisation tout est ok : HDR, 120fps, etc.
Les style graphique épuré peut plaire ou non, personnellement je l'ai trouvé assez lisse et 'transparent', rien de foufou mais c'est propre.
Les missions sont présentées avec un doublage vocale intégrale, et le scénario est assez creusé.
Reste que sa manque d'implication : les ordres de mission sont lus par un PNJ "en vignette", on ne voit jamais son perso 'en grand' dans une cinématique.
Et surtout les combats sont toujours les mêmes quelque soit la mission derrière, et sont mous du genoux ; aucun push et on s'ennuie très vite. En plus le rechargement des armes par éclair est mal fichu (peu lisible et peu maitrisable).
L'environnement insipide 90% du temps (mer en dessous/nuage au dessus) ne vient pas aider.
Après avoir fait le premier niveau et genre 15 fois la même mission pour le terminer j'ai jeté l'éponge au deuxième niveau voyant que c'était encore et toujours la même chose.
N'est pas panzer dragon qui le veut.

Joué sur SerieX via le game pass
Relatively fun, but just soulless and underdeveloped/funded for a main Pokemon series game.

reviews.title: JustLukas's review of Marvel's Midnight Suns

reviewText.content: Lately I have been playing a lot of games that don't use traditional combat. Marvel's Midnight Suns is right up my alley then. It is a weird mix of a tactical deck-building life simulator with an exploration elements on top. On paper, I have no idea how this passed the corporate vibe check, but it did. And I loved it. I have no idea why, because I do not love any of the aforementioned genres. It just works.

reviews.title: Great Tactics/Card game but it lost its luster for me quickly.

reviewText.content:
To start with the good, the actual card game mechanics work very well and that mixed with the tactics based gameplay, really make this a fun game to engage in. I was having a blast the first 15 hours on that side at least. I also like that you can upgrade and fuse duplicate cards together to make more powerful variants which is a fun mechanic. And I think they did well making each character feel distinct and cool to play with. A couple things annoyed me like some of the boss fights with one making me basically give up on continuing to play, since it was just not very well designed imo and the game just wasn't pulling me in enough to want to struggle through it. Also very annoyingly you can't skip enemy turns which just gets tedious as your forced to watch every single enemy do their moves and at the end of each turn enemies call in reinforcements, which just means you have more guys to waste your time, especially if your building up power and didn't take out too many enemies on a given turn.

The other thing is the graphics, which to be honest are not the best. Character models just look straight up ugly at times as they look like their out of a Sims game. Some moments the game can look nice but overall it's not a looker for me. The writing is also the one element that was heavily criticized and I would agree with people for the most part. There were some moments here and there like some of the scenes with Magik that were quite emotional for me, but otherwise it's mostly serviceable at best and cringe at worst. I found myself skipping a lot of the cutscenes because I just didn't care after a while. And the game really wants you to care with how much they try to use social mechanics from games like Persona or one of Bioware's RPGs. The problem is the writing quality is just not there to support it.

It is a very nice game that brings together 2d Zeldas with a little bit of metroidvania and a dark souls vibe. The combat mechanic is updated with the possibility to dodge and perform some different attacks, so it feels more alive than old Zelda games. Nice game with an interesting story overall.

This game can give a great experience to players new to the metroidvania/zelda/souls sort of genres. The art-style and lighting are definitely really pleasing and is what kept me playing the most. 

But for me the game in terms of game-play didn't stand out enough, upgrade mechanics felt really basic. It's getting inspiration from the games mentioned before but lack something truly innovative to spark more my interest.
A really cool take on dark souls like games. As someone who doesn't generally like dark souls i did enjoy this game and played it to completion. great side quests and main story.

Very good overall.
The combat is highly repetitive, mainly due to the lack of enemy and weapon variety. There are 5 weapons, one of which is a joke weapon, and they all play almost the same with almost the same damage. For me, this is easily the worst aspect of the game.
The map is interesting to explore.
The aesthetics and the soundtrack are excellent.
The plot is quite dull. There's the intro, then nothing happens up until the end.

A fantastic top down action-RPG, Death's Door brings to mind the early Zelda games, with modern design, combat, and light RPG elements. This game was excellent for many reasons, and was constantly engaging and interesting. 

Combat was at times difficult, but always rewarding for this gamer. The music accompaniment to each combat section made it feel almost like a rhythm game at times, and the difficulty, although high at times, felt fair and rewarding. Unlike many games given the "souls-like" label, this one allows you to keep experience between deaths, allowing you to power up after trying your hand at a particularly challenging section.  I did find one or two sections to be teeth-crunchingly difficult, to the point where they felt more like a chore, but thankfully, this was only present in a few sections. 

One of the standout features of this game is the gorgeous animation, and interesting character design. I got Ghibli vibes from certain characters, and for the most part, each character and level was exceedingly unique. Out of the varied levels, there was only one section of the Urn Witches mansion that I thought was rather uninteresting (the Furnace), and one boss that I thought looked a bit basic (think snowy level for a hint). These are minor criticisms. The story was also excellent for a game such as this; it was straightforward, but compelling to work through, and I enjoyed it immensely. 

I loved playing this game, and felt it was quite rewarding to playthrough. Having played on the Switch, the port performed well, with no crashes and constant framerate throughout my experience. Easy recommendation for fans of top down action-RPG's in the vein of early Zelda titles. Also a good experience for its challenging combat and world-building elements.

Loved every second of playing it. Only an accident that I wound up also having to play the umbrella run version of the game to complete all the achievements (just means I got to stream it twice!). The story is fun and all the side puns very much add something to this. For someone who doesn't normally enjoy souls / souls-like games, I really enjoyed it. It was described to me as a very forgiving souls-like, and I had seen my boyfriend play it already so I caved and bought it. You gotta look at it as it's okay I'm gonna die at some point, let's just deal with it, laugh and move on. Very fun, not too much gore or anything, combat wasn't too problematic and was easy to learn. The increasing level of boss difficulty was good, it didn't just go from super easy to hard as nails immediately (there is some ability to choose which boss you visit first though). Would love to see them make a Death's Door 2.

Good game, visually appealing. The art style is pretty but nothing new, although I was surprised by the lighting in different areas of the map. 
Original but weak storyline, main bad guy predictable. Very well implemented metroidvania elements, but the game didn't hook me enough to revisit all the areas and explore them again with the new upgrades. Well-made level design, reminiscent of Souls games, taking those detours and opening a door back to where you started. 
Bosses are nothing special except for a couple. The final boss is a weak remix of the previous ones, with a couple of new attacks. Gameplay is simplistic but fun and it works very well. Cool music. Lots of enemy repetition, 
All and all it's a short game definitely fun and worth spending time on.

reviews.title: Jeu dynamique avec une jolie direction artistique

reviewText.content:
Jeu dynamique avec une jolie direction artistique, la prise en main est intuitive et ne fait plus lâcher la manette.
Les combats sont durs mais justes (contrairement à Tunic), l'histoire suit sont cours sans en être le point fort elle fait le boulot.
Le gameplay évolue avec le déblocage de nouvelles compétence, qui fait revenir en arrière pour débloquer de nouvelles zones, classique mais bien réalisé et très agréable de se promener dans les différents niveaux depuis le hub.

Joué sur SeriesX via le gamepass.

Good graphics, some fun, but the fighting system and the story... disappointing, the only button you need to care is the X and Square Enix sold us an unfinished product, that's how I feel. At the end, isn't a Final Fantasy.

Final Fantasy XV is a return to form for Square Enix, a showcase of their willingness to adapt more Western approaches in their game development whilst also keeping what gave the series it’s charm, flair and personality.

Im Januar 2024 habe ich mir Final Fantasy 15 von meinem Pile of Shame geschnappt und im Stream gespielt, nachdem ich Jahre zuvor einfach nicht warm geworden bin mit diesem Spiel. Es war das Beste, was ich machen konnte. Durch meine Streams habe ich viele andere dazu motiviert, dem Spiel eventuell noch eine Chance zu geben. Und vielleicht motiviere ich den ein oder Anderen mit dieser Rezension.

Worum geht es? (spoilerfrei):

Insomnia - eine Stadt die jahrelang von einer Barriere geschützt wird und sich lange Zeit von der Welt abgeschottet hatte, schickt Prinz Noctis auf eine Reise. Noctis wird nämlich im Zuge einer Friedensverhandlung mit Niflheim bald seine Kindheitsfreundin heiraten. Begleitet von seiner Leibgarde und gleichzeitig seinen besten Freunden:

Ignis, Prompto und Gladio reisen sie mit ihrem Wagen "dem Regalia" durch das Land, um schon bald Altissia zu erreichen, wo er vermählt werden soll.

Doch die Friedensverhandlungen erweisen sich als kompliziert und Prinz Noctis muss schon bald lernen, was es heißt, ein König zu sein.

Gameplay:

Anders als das typische rundenbasierte Kampfsystem - was der eingefleischte Final Fantasy - Fan so kennt - hast du in diesem Game ein "action Kampfsystem"

Als Prinz Noctis hast du die Fähigkeit, deine ausgerüsteten Waffen wie aus dem Nichts zu beschwören und kannst deinen Freunden Befehle erteilen, die dich zusätzlich im Kampf unterstützen.
Gladio ist wie ein typischer Tank, Ignis kämpft gerne mit Element-Dolchen und Prompto ein guter Fernkämpfer.

Neben dem Kampfsystem haben die Gefährten auch unterschiedliche Skills wie "Kochen" "Überleben" "Angeln" oder "Fotografie"

Die Openworld:

Einen Großteil des Spiels wirst du in einer offenen Welt verbringen. Die Openworld ist überschaubar und nicht so überladen mit Gegenständen oder Quests. Auch wenn die Map eventuell wie eine "gähnende Leere" wirkt, sie kommt dennoch sehr realistisch rüber - stets im Wechsel zwischen schönen Landschaften und einem Highway. Während ihr durch die Länder streift, stoßt ihr auf Notizen mit kleinen Infos über die Story.

Die Geschichte & die Kritik daran:

Einige werden eventuell schon gehört haben, dass FF15 sehr viel Kritik bezüglich der Story bekommen hat.

Das hat vor allem den Grund, weil viele sich ein Final Fantasy versus XIII gewünscht haben, was ursprünglich düsterer sein sollte und dann im Laufe der Zeit verändert und in Final Fantasy XV umbenannt wurde.
Noctis sollte ursprünglich den Tod symbolisieren und ein Anführer von "Reapern" werden, weswegen die Jungs in der heutigen Version alle schwarz tragen und die Gruppe völlig unberechtigt als "Emo-Boys" bezeichnet wird.

Hajime Tabata bestätigte bedauerlicherweise, dass er die Story umschreiben MUSSTE, um den Alters-Richtlinien anderer Länder gerecht zu werden. Zusätzlich wurde Nomura (dem eigentlichen Producer von FF13 versus) entzogen und Hajime Tabata übernahm die Verantwortung für FF15.
Square Enix wollte ihr Spiel nämlich großflächiger in anderen Ländern an den Markt bringen.

DENNOCH ist Final Fantasy XV kein schlechtes Spiel!

Nebenaufgaben & Jagdaufträge:

Die Nebenaufgaben (blau) sind überschaubar und belohnen einen mit zusätzlichen Dialogen, Cutscenes und kleinen Hintergrundstorys über die Charaktere, so dass diese nicht sinnlos und stupide erscheinen.

Dann haben wir die Jagd-Quests (Gelb). Besiege Monster und dann bekommst du Geld. Ist das stupide? Ja. Zieht es das Spiel vielleicht unnötig in die Länge? Auch.
Aber was macht man hauptsächlich als Jäger um seinen Lebensunterhalt zu verdienen? Richtig. Jagen. Vor allem am Anfang habt ihr Geld bitter nötig.

Ich persönlich mag das Jagdsystem, denn somit konnte ich nebenbei auch noch ein wenig die Welt erkunden.

Wo ist meine Magie? Das Magiesystem:

Während ältere Final Fantasy Teile bestimmte Bücher mit Magie zur Verfügung stellen, damit die Charaktere diese erlernen - musst du in der Welt an Lagerplätzen und in Dungeons die Magie (Feuer, Eis und Blitz) "in dir aufnehmen", "lagern" und mit anderen Elementen oder Items kombinieren.

Noctis kann nämlich eine begrenzte Anzahl an Magie absorbieren und kann diese erst wieder neu aufnehmen, wenn er die bereits gespeicherte Magie synthetisiert und aufbraucht. Je nach Element oder Item kannst du diese Magie dann verstärken. Ein Heiltrank + Eismagie kann z.b Vita oder Vitra ergeben. Blitz Magie mit Maschinen-Teilen kann z.b die Blitzmagie verstärken. Je mehr Items oder Magie eines anderen Elements, desto stärker am Ende die Magie.

Magie ist in EOS aber nicht unbedingt zwingend notwendig.

Denn richtig eingesetzt, kann die Magie sehr viel Schaden machen und das Spiel um einiges erleichtern. Wer aber die Herausforderung sucht, der verzichtet vielleicht darauf.

Dungeons:

Du hast Dungeons und diese sind gar nicht mal so schlecht. Sie sind "schwer" genug und interessant zu erforschen. Hast du aber eine sehr schlechte Orientierung, kann die Map ein wenig frustrieren, da die Verließe unglaublich verwinkelt sein können.

Fazit:

Gebt diesem Spiel eine Chance. Versucht euch dabei zu entspannen - denkt einfach an ein "Wandertrip"

Das Spiel war nämlich wie ein Urlaubs-Trip unter Freunden. Mich haben die Dialoge ziemlich abgeholt und unterhalten auf längere Zeit, auch wenn sie sich wiederholt haben.

Sobald ich über das Gröbste hinweg war, hat mich die Story ziemlich gehittet und hinterließ mich zurück mit Tränen. Wer ein dramatisches Final Fantasy spielen möchte, dann ist das das Richtige für euch. DLC und Zusatzstorys gibt es in der Final Fantasy Windows-Edition. Einzig das Ardyn DLC musst du nachkaufen.

Alright, so I played this game more or less on Normal once in a while going on too hard for some challenges. I will honestly say that I can't really tell when beats hit so I used some accessibility features during my run. Even without them, I would say that this game does have a challenge and it is a really good game to play to wind down during the night. I really love how this game is played with the top left and right arrow keys but I used the W, A, and D keys as well as SPACE.

Game Dev Tycoon ? This is the best game ever by Kairosoft.
I player on iPad and this is really well done.
1 -Humoristic like some Bullfrog's old game like Theme Park or Theme Hospital
2 -Detailead: player can see the evolution of different gaming console
3 - A lot of vg generes, evolution and staff's skills

Really a good game 9/10

reviews.title: In another life, we could have been something

reviewText.content:
Unfortunately for it, I played Game Dev Tycoon first and nothing Game Dev Story does, not even the pixel art, could sway me from the thought of "I might just turn this off and play Game Dev".
It's a very well thought out, great looking game (I'm not really fond of the UI though...) and I can see why so many people like it, but to me Game Dev Tycoon feels superio

reviews.title: hungrymanning's review of Another Crab's Treasure

reviewText.content:
Another Crab's Treasure is the newest addition to the burgeoning genre of Souls-Like and it is a stellar game, I can't lie. This game has soul and wit, with visual puns and underwater-themed curse words that captures a blend of child-like wonder with the sad polluted reality that plague are oceans today. The story is simple with a character that feels all too relatable, especially for introverts like myself.

The perfect combination of fun and creative combat with beautiful level design, enhanced by neat visuals and incredible music that flows with your characters actions and vibes perfectly with the settings. The platforming was an unexpected treat with the use of being underwater utilized in ways that are very satisfying. Its a game that takes a lot from the games that're popular in its genre, but it executes them well, feeling more homage than cliche.

There were some performance issues, like frame rates plummeting/ stuttering. It was fairly consistent and the spots that had it always had it. It only momentarily took away from what was otherwise a phenomenal game. But I was very frustrated when these were happening towards the late game when enemies were around.

The boss battles are always my favorite part of an action/ adventure-rpg and Another Crab's Treasure nailed them in almost every way. As a Souls-like, I'd say its boss roster is as impressive as last year's Lies of P. I wish there was a New Game Plus or at least a Boss Rush Mode for after you beat the game as to experience them once again without having to sink 15-25 hours into a playthrough. Granted, you can always go to easy mode and strap on a gun and get through it in like 5.

The last two things I like to highlight were the voice performances. I. Loved. Each. Voice. I wish there was more of it, if anything. And this game nailed the easter eggs, paying homage to so many games, IPs, and undersea references - with a few standouts being its Dark Souls homages and the tribute to Frederick, Michael Reeve's famous financial fish (Reeves also voices the character Firth). And one last shoutout to the song at the end of the game (if you know, you know).

reviews.title: A truly enjoyable and relaxing MMO experence!

reviewText.content:
If your looking for an MMO without all the crazy combat.  With just the fun of exploring, grinding, and solving puzzles & quests.  Then this is most definitely the game for you.
  First, there appears to be no type of violent actions between fellow players and the NPC's.  The only type of violence found is hunting for animal meat and hides.  But even this show no type of physical harm.  Example: When shooting a deer with a bow, the animal just disappears and the loot is left behind.  No guts, no blood, no screams of pain.
  I'm using a NVIDIA Geforce RTX 3060 on max settings, and the game looks amazing.   The environment leaves you with a feeling of calmness and relaxation.  Playing in this environment makes game play so much more fun and enjoyable.  
 The game also has different skill sets to build on. Like fishing, cooking, gardening, mining, hunting, bug catching, foraging, and furniture making.
  You start the game with your own house that you can customize with items from the npc's or items you built yourself.  Your also able to buy clothing for your character from the in-game store to make the player your own.
Es un juego que te sumerge con su sonidos en una paz, me encanta este juego, un juego en el que puedes hacer una vida nueva.

Fantastic game! The best i've played in a long while. Zero downsides to playing this game, endless things to do with and without people if you desire. It's also 100% free, literally. Completely free. There's little, to zero bugs, which to me, is unheard of. The team always gives away awesome Twitch drops, which is good for streamers looking for more viewership and bringing in a larger community just looking to genuinely have a good time. The community that plays this game is also very helpful, giving tips or providing items you need or just want. Great for kids because the atmosphere in this game is awesome, it's made up of wonderful people looking to have a good time with friends and family. You can build, hunt, fish, forage, the list goes onnn. Great storylines, the voice acting is superb and gives the characters depth. The world is beautiful and the music is really stellar. They hired live orchestras, showing you a video on how it was created and made (my favorites are the Maji Market). They have Holidays in the game twice a year and you can play Hot Pot! All around 10/10 game.

This game is kind of like that. Every door has a keypad or a lock, every obstacle you face is obviously a puzzle where there is a solution for it somewhere. But you don't know if you can solve it right now, or you are supposed to come later. As a result, you collect these puzzles without solutions, and aimlessly wander around the world which presents you a scenario from time to time to pull you from the rounds you take looking for the next puzzle or a possible solution.

reviews.title: timmykimmel's review of Lunch A Palooza

reviewText.content:
I have no idea anymore how I got into this game, but maybe there were a few promille involved.
The idea is quite nice, the game is also extensive - but I have probably not played such a disastrously controllable game since the 90-ies.

Super Meat Boy is a wildly inventive, sadistically challenging, and extremely competitive game. It's squishy, lovable and full of life, and it’s platforming at it’s very best.

To start things off, no matter if your time is spent dying repeatedly or beating levels consecutively, the game flows together seamlessly. The controls really add sense of seamlessness as well, in that there's never a moment where you feel as if you've been cheated out of a victory.

The difficulty is brutal, but it's honestly a bit refreshing to see a game come along with such a high level of challenge. This challenge helps motivate the player to keep going, to give a particularly difficult stage just “one more go”. Even after you've mastered a level, there's always this nagging sense of competition coming from the game's online leaderboards, challenging the player to discover new shortcuts or utilize different characters in order to shave off just a few milliseconds from a run. 

The game is highly replayable in this regard, because in addition to trying to earn A+ ranks on a level, there’s 101 bandages to collect spread across the game, ramping up the difficulty even further for those interested, even to sometimes frustrating degrees. But once you manage to get that bandaid, beat that level, or move up in the rankings, the sense of accomplishment is enormously rewarding

The game charms extend outside of the gameplay as well. The cutscenes are hilarious; the wonderfully animated expressions convey Meatboy's emotions perfectly, and the music suits the game's tone, almost giving you a beat to match your rhythm and timing as you make your precise little jumps. The graphics cover a wide variety of styles to original Gameboy graphics, to high definition B+W silhouettes.

To add to Super Meat Boy’s quirks are the titles of the levels themselves, showcasing a playful admiration for creativity in its references, which range from metal bands such as Boris and Mastodon to cult film directors like David Lynch and Alejandro Jodorowsky.  The game also includes free DLC levels that are updated fairly regularly and soon will include user created levels made by users of the PC version of the game. It'll be interesting to see how the two versions are able to interact with each other.

It's one of the most satisfying and addicting experiences I've had in years, and I love it with all my heart and soul. It's got the feel of retro arcade game with a modern day amount of depth to its physics.

Super Meat Boy is a good little platformer (very similar to N/N+), which starts easy, but gets very tough eventually. The levels are beautiful, the controls and mechanics are good. If you are into tough platformers, you will enjoy this game for sure (especially the boss battles). The rest will give up after stage 2. :)

Гроза клавиатур и геймпадов, примерно так бы я назвал эту игру. В центре сюжета выступает Мясной Пацан. Его возлюбленную похитил Доктор Зародыш и на протяжении всей игры мы будем пытаться спасти девушку. Если бы не хардкорный геймплей, то игра бы ничем не выделялась на фоне остальных таких же игр, где надо спасти возлюбленную. В игре всего 6 глав, после прохождения основной игры открывается еще 1 глава, где мы играем за эту самую возлюбленную и спасаем Мясного Пацана. В игре присутствует система повышения сложности, чем дальше, тем сложнее.

Why in hell will someone make a game with no mouse support in 2019?
I have refunded the game and I am really disappointed....

Blasphemous, un video juego que cuenta una buena historia y tiene un gameplay bastante bueno y entretenido, Con jefes que son algo complicados y muy entretenidos, asi como algunos memorables, con personajes igual memorables.
Great game all around. I have enjoyed the fast paced gameplay and the cyberpunk theme. The best soundtrack ever, really emerging.
The game Ruiner in TLDR has been just about what is being said in the beginning: "Kill the boss". Straightforward.

I have played the handsome edition a bit more than 42 hours on PC. I installed the HD packed. The game looks awesome, it is a FPS with a lot of loot. The enemies are some kind of crazy madmax people and other monsters. The main vilain is pretty funny. Borderlands is very fun to play and I am not a FPS guy. I finished the main story and I started playing the tiny tina DLC which is quite fun too.

Do you like playing first person shooter with small of rpg elements and ability trees, Borderland franchise is what right for you who likes grinding and loot items such rare weapons and items that help you finish the quest or fight boss without too much effort after finishing one side quest to other while you shoot same thing over and over. That’s my impression for every rpg games, and its not bad thing.

Borderland is kind of the game that you hate to play due the repetitiveness in every single quest, shoot and loot by fight against one level up stronger enemies, fetching cryptic items to reveal storyline and also inflated money that is useless to use after getting strong item to equip. And still, players can really enjoy the game theme where you can pick four different class characters which the storyline consist of bounty hunter in wasteland planet called Pandora. 

The humourous tone of story-telling that makes killing psycho looks fun meanwhile players get spouted of 00’s meme catchphrase along the game by non-playable characters who are borderline of funny and annoying with the screaming and quips. Its very enjoyable storyline to get to know about an ambitious main boss want to control the planet which personally makes think its great writing of character who makes player chuckle in every single line the boss said any thing. 

During the game, players can get to know more stories about character and lore if doing quest where the game relies on audio recording instead of cutscenes, but don’t bother too much doing all the task because some are too hard to do and player have to backtrack in any visited map if the players just want to progress the game only playing the main quest and that’s it, some DLC are worth to play for story but being too dull if players are already over-level because killing enemy will become a chore than challenging, there is something about “BS moment” where sometimes if players are too over-confident to fight against horde of enemy, they are likely become more hard to kill and seems the universe in this game want you to die which cost a lot of your earning money. 

Borderland 2 is easy to play the game if players know how to build the skillset and know the role, eventhough I finish the game playing solo, this game can be fun as co-op game because the world and athmosphere of open world with its own unique style gives plus value because its not like AAA 3D games that will age after one decade. So its pleasing game to enjoy with friends or just playing alone.

As sidenote : Borderland 1 has slight different theme where its trying to be more serious game where later the tone in the sequel becomes more light-hearted and funny.
Enjoyable FPS game with storyline. Cartoonish style looks really cool with HD pack. Some DLC's are not as good as game but they are okay.

reviews.title: thecrowspain's review of Midnight Fight Express

reviewText.content:
"Midnight Fight Express" is an indie action game released in 2023. It was launched on various platforms, including PlayStation, Xbox, and PC. The game belongs to the beat 'em up genre, combining fast-paced combat with a retro aesthetic.

The game was developed by Osumia Games, a relatively new studio known for their unique take on action gameplay. The director of "Midnight Fight Express" is Tero Piirainen, who has previously worked on other indie titles known for their creative mechanics.

The script for the game was penned by Dario Seyb, who has a background in creating engaging narratives for indie games. The music was composed by Jukio Kallio, a versatile composer responsible for the soundtracks of games like "Nuclear Throne" and "Minit."

"Midnight Fight Express" employs a stylized pixel art aesthetic that captures the essence of retro beat 'em up games. The game's graphics are heavily influenced by classic titles, and the visual effects enhance the old-school vibe while modernizing the experience.

In terms of sound design, the game utilizes impactful punches, kicks, and environmental cues to create an immersive auditory experience. This, combined with the pixel art visuals, contributes to a nostalgic yet fresh atmosphere.

Overall, "Midnight Fight Express" deserves a score of 8 on PC due to its engaging combat, unique visual style, and well-crafted audio design.

reviews.title: khajiitlinetosneak's review of Midnight Fight Express

reviewText.content:
It takes about half the game before the story becomes interesting, but I was definitely rewarded for sticking to it. At first it's a bit corny and repetitive, but during the second half the game finds its pace, the story and action are working great together and learning new combos to take down enemies is fun and addictive.
That being said, of course the game has some negatives. I don't like that you can basically win the game by spamming only one or two combos, which is partly because most of the enemies are very similar in combat. You only have to learn a few basic mechanics, and then you are done. Which is not necessarily a bad thing, but it starts to show in a game with 6 hours of pure combat.
I think the dev did an awesome job and added a lot of things for his game. I also think the story is polished and interesting enough for the theme, with a lot of references. I'm really looking forward to the implied sequel, where I hope for an even bigger and more complex skill tree as well as enemies.

reviews.title: acnari's review of Valiant Hearts: The Great War

reviewText.content: This game is one of my all-time favourites. The characters drew me into their stories like very few other games have, and the gameplay itself was unique, surprising, and diverse. I will eventually go back to this game (if I'm ever able to catch up on my backlog), as it was one of those rare gems which left me sitting in silence for quite some time after completing it-reflecting on what I had experienced and relishing the strong emotions it created in me. This game is absolutely fantastic.

reviews.title: basileonardo's review of Valiant Hearts: The Great War

reviewText.content: It is a simple game, not at all challenging, almost a graphic novel heavily supported by the story, its visuals, and music. I loved it! It was very satisfying and moving.

reviews.title: Histoire narrative historique intéressante et prenante

reviewText.content:
Excellente direction artistique, le jeu est relativement court, mais c'est du temps bien utilisé (~7/8h d'après Steam lorsque je l'ai fait "à l'époque" sur PC). Beaucoup de détails historiques très intéressants et toujours bien situés par rapport au contexte des chapitres dans lesquels on joue.

Refait sur SeriesX à l'occasion d'un abonnement UbiSoft+, toujours autant de plaisir à y jouer.
Le moteur UbiArt fonctionne parfaitement avec l'aspect narratif, les compléments historiques sont toujours aussi intéressants, et le jeu toujours aussi prenant.
Donc jeu qui a très bien vieilli :)

Lights.  Camera.  Action!  Take the role of an actor on an ocean liner for a strange and mysterious project.  But something is wrong…you aren’t ready yet and the director urges you to put your character together.  Memory melds with darkness and strange things happen with every turn of the head.  Travel through the various layers of the ship and your mind to find your character, your story, and your fear.

It is important to note that Layers of Fear 2 is not like its predecessor.  While the game employs similar creepy effects and scares from the previous game; Layers of Fear 2 is still its own game with its own story and scares.  As such, I am going review Layers of Fear 2 apart from the first game—giving it an opportunity to shine on its own.

Layers of Fear 2 is a first-person exploration horror game—with heavy emphasis on the horror.  Here you play as the protagonist, an enigmatic actor, onboard a steam liner with an mysterious Director giving you direction on how to build your character.  As you explore the ship; reality seems to bend and you begin to learn more about what is going on.  Five acts span the game where you delve more into the remarkable story with each act more horrific than the last all the way up to the thrilling conclusion.

The environment is truly creepy, and the atmosphere is dark, oppressive, and heavy; and it is this aspect of the game that is my favorite part about Layers of Fear 2.  The atmosphere really shines through spectacularly and strange scenes and eerie happening await you at almost every turn of a corridor or room—causing unease as your walk about the ship.  It is important to note that there are several tastefully done jump scares as well as a couple of chase scenes that may cause a bit of anxiety.

I enjoyed the story very much even though it was somewhat confusing after the first playthrough.  However, subsequent playthroughs helped solidify the story a bit more clearly.  I found the story deep and intriguing while still managing to be pleasingly enigmatic at the same time.

The controls are easy to learn.  You will spend a lot of time moving around, looking around, and picking items up and the means of control are intuitive.  I recommend using the controller although the mouse and keyboard are also a viable option.

The voice acting is spot on and the sound effects are perfect.  Every whisper, knock, or other sound you hear while traveling the storyline add to the discomfort while the voice acting gives the story in clear and concise manner.

There is a slew of achievements to attain; a good portion of which you will need to challenge yourself to find while others are based on the story itself.  Additionally, there are three separate endings, with their own achievements, requiring three separate playthroughs for those completionists out there.  As a note: there is a NewGame+ feature that unlocks after completing the game for the first time; allowing you to find additional achievements and mysteries that can only be found in this feature.

I thoroughly enjoyed Layers of Fear 2 and I felt that it was a great sequel to the first game.  Everything collaborated well and gave a wonderful experience from start to finish.  I found the story to be quite exciting, engaging, and horrific and it is a tale that will stay with me for quite some time.  I recommend Layers of Fear 2 for those who played the first game or for those who love well-done horror games.  So turn off the lights, sit back…

…and don’t look behind you.

Este é um daqueles jogos que você encontra no Steam e pensa: "Ah, mais um metroidvania." Entretanto, esse não é o caso; trata-se de um jogo linear de ação em 2D que oferece uma experiência relativamente curta, porém agradável.

A narrativa coloca você no controle de Ardeshir, um soldado da chama eterna, que retorna à sua ilha apenas para descobrir que ela foi envolvida por uma névoa misteriosa, exigindo que ele desvende os acontecimentos.

O jogo utiliza o elemento do fogo de uma maneira que me agradou bastante. O fogo serve como proteção contra a névoa negra, mas também desempenha um papel crucial na abertura de portas e na resolução de quebra-cabeças. Considerando a história centrada em um "soldado da chama eterna", é fascinante ver como o fogo é peça fundamental na narrativa e na jogabilidade.

Além das mecânicas relacionadas ao fogo, a parte de plataforma do jogo é igualmente envolvente. Apreciei os momentos em que era necessário correr, pular entre plataformas e acertar tochas com adagas para desbloquear o caminho.

Embora eu tenha notado algumas críticas em relação à duração do jogo, pessoalmente, não acredito que todo jogo precise oferecer uma experiência extensa. Para mim, as pouco mais de 3 horas de jogo proporcionaram uma experiência satisfatória.

reviews.title: Fun little indie dungeon crawler with guns!

reviewText.content:
The shooting is really fun in this game, as you go from room to room in 2D side scroller fashion. It does use a twin stick shooter system, that I generally detest playing with controllers, but I have found its much better on keyboard and mouse. The game overall controled really well and I found it easy to zip around and take out enemies. The guns you pick up in this game are a lot of fun to use to. The game does feature difficulty settings which I'm not used to in these types of games and it felt nice to be able to play on something like easy. A far cry from games like Slay the Spire where you can only get an "easy" mode through modding.

I also loved the exploration of the dungeons, as you go from room to room, as the map slowly starts to build out, highlighting key items and locations. As a QoF feature, it even highlights things you left over, like if you were at full health and didn't need pick ups but can easily travel back when you do need them. You also find plenty of fast travel points every few rooms to make getting around the dungeon a bit easier which in turn makes exploration more rewarding. You can also find special rooms like catherdrals that will often have cool relics, upgrades or equipment to pick up that gives you cool bonuses. You can also stack on multiple helmets, masks and hoods which can look ridiculous after a while but it just adds to the fun. As you kill bosses you pick up faith gems, which is the currency you take back with you at the end of your runs. These can be used to unlock new playable characters, as well as new types of rooms or game rules that can appear during your runs. This adds a fun building mechanic of sorts and you can toggle things you've unlocked on or off, which I found to be a nice touch.

As for story, there is one in the game, but its very simplistic. Its very meta about game development and they keep referencing Hades the game which I thought was cool. A lot of the items you pickup as well are references to other games and franchises which I liked too. Overall the story is mostly just in the background and isn't that groundbreaking, but the gameplay is fun which I think makes up for it.

Some of things I didn't like are small, but they really dragged down the score for me. The first is not having a save and exit option mid runs which is a major drawback. There is an exit option which takes you back to the hub area, but doing this will make you lose progress in the dungeon but you do at least get to keep any gems you've picked up. Games like Slay the Spire let you save and exit mid run, and its very convenient since runs can get so long, especially in this game. As you defeat bosses, the dungeons just get longer and longer which doesn't help with their being no way to leave without losing progress. The dungeons are proceedurly generated which does help keep the layouts fresh, but the background art just looks so dull and samey after a while.

The major issue for me though is the lack of item descriptions before you pick something up. Once you do pick up something you do get clear descriptions but only once its picked up. This would usually be fine, but the game is constantly making you have to choose between 2 items whether it be in treasure rooms or at the merchants shop. I guess the intent is for you to experiment and familirize yourself with items just by looking at them, but I'm just not into that. Every time I encountered items I was not about to waste gold on something or pick up something at the cost of another, just on pure luck of the draw. I ended up just googling the items to find out what they did, and it got tedious after a while. You can unlock a character later that can see item descriptions before picking them up, but he has a major downside that makes him harder to play with. I shouldn't be punished or forced to play as one specific character just to see item descriptions. I know some roguelites do that, but there are plenty of ones like Slay the Spire that don't and I prefer the latter.

This game is amazing.
Start with insane electronic beats that will drive you crazy.
Continue with acid 8bit style of neon-packed 80s.
Bring convoluted story which makes no sense (or does it?)
Dont forget lightning fast skill based gameplay, which will frustrate you just the right amount to get you in the correct mood.
Top it off with incredible atmosphere that ties it all together.
Then you get Hotline Miami.
Most def one of the highlights of 2013 gaming year and a must play.

I played only seven chapters, out of twenty, and I will say this: it is so satisfying to chain an entire floor in a long combo, but the hoops you need to jump through to get to this point undercut the eventual euphoria. Undoubtedly, there is potential here, and I hope they did improve on this foundation in Hotline Miami 2, which I look forward to trying.

Hotline Miami is an amazing top down shooter that will have you on the edge of your seat as you fight your way through rooms of enemies.
Coupled with it's amazing soundtrack, the game really makes you feel like a bad ass.

One of the best indie games that I played from this last decade. Even though I am only giving the game a 8/10, it's mainly for the console version, since the PC version would be a 9/10 for me. The console version is good, but the controls can sometimes be a pain, especially when trying to go for 100% completion of the entire game. The game has a great OST, great level designs, and a huge variety of weapons and masks that create multiple playstyles all drove by a 80s aesthetic. Some of the levels and bosses can be a bit tedious since there is only so much they can program in here, but overall the gameplay is fantastic. I recommend picking this game up when it goes on sale on either the PS4 store and/or Steam for a short but fun game.

A fast-paced game packed with violence and gore, Hotline Miami is about a man who receives mysterious calls that tell him to commit massacres at specific places. The player can use a wide array of weapons that classify as melee, firearms, or throwables. They can even throw melee weapons and guns at enemies to kill or knock them down. It takes only one attack to kill you, so you should be quick and strategic as you kill all the enemies to progress. The gameplay is unique and fun while also being challenging. The story is okay at best, but that's fine because the main focus of this game is the gameplay. Overall, Hotline Miami is a fast and violent game for people who want a challenge filled with destructive mayhem.

Вообще сюжет у Hotline Miami очень сложный и запутанный. Мы даже не знаем имя главного героя, но все называют его Джекет. Скорее всего это из за его куртки. Я вам сейчас поведаю сюжет, уже распутанный, дабы вы его хотя бы примерно поняли. Джекет находится  в коме, у него видения о не так давно прошедших событиях. Каким то образом он вступил в организацию "50 Благословений". Организация эта боролась с русской мафией. Делала она это с помощью звонков на телефон, и с помощью запутанных сообщений отправляла людей на убийство мафиози. Одним из убийц и был Джекет. Так, он разобрался с главой мафии - Отцом, после чего убил и отца Отца :D. На этом и закончилась история Джекета в Hotline Miami. Он вышел на балкон и закурил сигару. Титры. Но это еще не все, после этого нам показывают историю Байкера - одну из жертв Джекета. В ходе этой истории Байкер каким-то образом выжил, но скорее всего это было сделано, чтобы довести рассказ до конца, а так, на деле он мертв. Этот сюжет и есть первый плюс игры. Вторым плюсом я засчитаю хардкорность игры. Минусов нет - это шедевр.

Hotline Miami is a fast pace twin-stick shooter, with one hell of a soundtrack and an interesting story. You fight your way through areas stuffed with enemies who you need to mow down without getting hit. At times it can be a bit frustrating but the quick reset makes it super easy to jump back in the action after you die- which will happen a lot! The story is gritty and the setting is trippy. Give this one a try if you're looking for a relatively short blood-soaked experience!

reviews.title: "Do you like to hurt other people?"

reviewText.content:
Hotline Miami is a tale about violence and the drive us humans may have for it. It is thoroughly dark and sickening, and yet there is something about the mechanics and sets of challenges using stealth and a sense of rhythm to strike that makes it all ominously addictive.

The game will be dropping you different animal masks to wear over time to change your play style altogether, you can use the environment to your advantage as well to perform your brutal acts more effectively.
There will be many times you will be very frustrated by the seemingly random moments you get executed by a random henchman that was out of your view, and yet each defeat you suffer is a moment to re-examine your strategy and put your trigger fingers to the test.

I would describe Hotline Miami as one of those games where everything fits perfectly, even the title. What is the first thing that comes to mind when you hear “Hotline Miami”? Neon lights, narcotics, crime - that's what this game is about. A drug fuelled slather with no rational motive or purpose. The gameplay manages to match this energy, thus leading to the cult status that Hotline Miami has obtained. 
I would recommend it to anyone who wants a fast-paced game within a setting rarely seen in gaming. The game is short, however it does make up for it with its replay value.

Story
You play as a guy who took just the right drugs to turn into a killing machine. Now you receive orders from wherever, that decide which crime den you will assault next.
I was quite invested in the story, more so for finding out what will happen next than anything else, but I can't say I was disappointed.

Mechanics and gameplay
The gameplay loop is simple - enter a level, pick a mask, kill everyone.
This is deceptively simple, most enemies are either incapacitated or killed in one hit, but so are you. This leads to some very intense fights as you try to kill all enemies before they get a shot off. 
In terms of replay value at the end of every encounter, you get points depending on how fast and stylish you were. A lot of time can be spent trying to figure out what's the most lethal route you can take in every level. I would recommend it if you have the reaction time.

Graphics and artstyle
Top down 2D and quite simplistic, but it conveys what it has to. 
A lot of effort has been put into presenting the “vibe” of the game through the artstyle. This can be seen in the use of bright colours and trippy visuals.

Atmosphere/Immersion  
As I said - a bloody drug induced trance. It pulls it off incredibly well, there is no mechanic or part that detracts from it. 
It's hard to say I was immersed, it would be more correct to say I was invested.

Soundtrack
The OST matches the intensity of the combat and the hazy hangover-like levels in-between the action. Personally not my type of music, but there is hardly anything better for a game like this. My favourite part of the soundtrack is “Crystals”.

Final Thoughts
Why the long face?

Souldiers is a well-rounded Metroidvania. It ticks all boxes to be a great game, but it has some faults that hold it back a little, like the lack of responsiveness of controls from time to time, lack of proper reward for exploration, the way some enemies are set up or the terrible loading times for a game were we die a lot.

Even so, it deserves a positive grade.

reviews.title: A game with his own personality in the 40k world

reviewText.content:
The turn-based strategy genre blows my mind (XCOM super fan) and this Mechanicus does not disappoint. He has good ideas, his own personality and I love how it reflects 40k.

First of all, the story is nothing special, but the conversations of the subdominus are entertaining. In addition, the setting is so well achieved that everything around you helps to get you into the world of 40k.

In the other hand, combat mechanics are good. You have different disciplines for each techpriest with a lot of options and Augment equipment for your characters, Additionally, you can discover guns or some objects in your run through the tombs, that you can equipt later.

With all of that in combat u can do a lot of actions, depending on your wepons, equipment and discipline of your techpriest. This disciplines have different passives for each character, and let you do some different actions in combat like buff damage for your wepons or more deffense for your team.

Additionally, you can have troops too, which I find very interesting and without a doubt a great success, cause they add more strategy to the game. They can be uplocked in missions, and in the same way u can upgrade them through the game. We have different types of this troops and with more game difficult, the more you need to choose wisely this characters and know when to use them.

They way you can get weapons, or upgrades for your troops, is doing missions for the subdominus, a mechanic so gratefull cause u can choose what mission, and for who, u want to do, with differents regards that can change entire game for you in the next battle.

The awakening mechanic is also interesting. It gives you a purpose with a time limit that is in line with your mission and adds a plus of difficulty to the game in general.

Like i said, i loved this game, and his try to not simply copy/paste the XCOM franchise. Developers tried here to give his own personality and they did it. Game is so fun and you have to learn things to play good in this 40k world.

Recommended. 8/10

Regards.

Derrière son air mignon kawaiiiiii, se cache un jeu tactique difficile, où chaque combat doit être âprement mené.
Pas de vie regénérée à chaque combat, des difficultés de route à bien considérer (plus c'est difficile plus il y a d'xp à la clef), pas de farm possible (chaque combat est unique), uniquement deux check points par niveau (au milieu du chapitre et avant le boss), des ressources limitées avec différents axes d'améliorations possibles à choisir, etc.
Le jeu est donc difficile et demande constamment à bien réfléchir avant toute action, en combat ou hors combat (les "interludes" permettant de gérer son équipe et son équipement).
L'histoire est intéressante et chaque chapitre passé fait pousser un grand ouf de soulagement en donnant envie de continuer à voir la suite :)

Joué sur SeriesX via le game pass.

Jugabilidad: muy cómoda, hay cosas que quedan ambiguas como que si atacas mientras apuntas hacia arriba haces una ataque especial, pero la jugabilidad es realmente muy cómoda y coherente a lo largo del juego, la forma en que mejoramos las armas y el personaje también, las armaduras y armas son muy variadas cada una escalando con un ámbito diferente ya sea fuerza o destreza asi que puedes fácilmente tener un arma muy fuerte sin necesidad de transmutar o buscar en las esquinas del mapa por un super arma ya que algunas se adaptaran a tu estilo de juego, las clases están bien planteadas aunque solo te dan una pequeña ventaja en el árbol de habilidades según la características de estas después puedes ir escalando a tu personaje y personalizándolo a tu gusto, el juego no se llega a sentir lento ni agobiante, es muy disfrutable y cada mecánica esta bien planteada, a ser un metroidvania nos da habilidades en el caso de este juego "marcas" que nos permitirán acceder a zonas que no podíamos acceder antes, y lo bueno es que no rompen con la ambientación o el sentimiento del juego, algunos enemigos y jefes seguirán siendo intimidantes y el mapa no se volverá un paseo ya que las marcas están muy bien planteadas nada de doble salto, o atravesar paredes, podremos dar saltos entre paredes o desbloquear zonas usando la antorcha pero no un gran cambio en la movilidad, excepto con el sprint aéreo que si nos da una mayor velocidad al desplazarnos pero como lo obtenemos tarde no afecta mucho y en combate esta habilidad no nos garantizara la victoria, en fin una jugabilidad cómoda y bien planteada 

Diseño de Niveles: El mapa, los jefes y los enemigos esta todo bien repartido, no hay zonas que estén repletas de enemigos molestos pero tampoco hay zonas despejadas que son un paseo, las zonas de descanso y todo esta puesto muy bien y el mapa es demasiado bueno, no tenemos un mapa dentro del juego pero todas las zonas están conectadas por lo que a veces terminaras haciendo backtraquin sin tu saberlo y podrás seguir descubriendo las cosas que te ocultaba el mapa el cual es muy grande, la dificultad es justa hay enemigos muy difíciles otros fáciles todo depende de como juegues, a veces no recae tanto en memorizar patrones si no en tu propia habilidad para esquivar y reaccionar así que todo esta bien planteado y la forma en que tu personaje va escalando es muy buena 

Gráficos: un estilo grafico muy característico, todas las zonas y personajes son distintos y la estética es maravillosa, no se siente monótono hay zonas muy diferenciadas por lo que no es todo gris con un blur de fondo, es un estilo grafico muy bueno y dinámico construyendo un gran ambiente 

Soundtrack: Decente, pocas canciones me quedaron grabadas cumplen su función y hay una que otra buena pero sin dudas es posiblemente el punto mas flojo del juego

reviews.title: the_bambusak's review of Salt and Sanctuary

reviewText.content: Top 2D Souls experience. Combat with coop can be super fun. The setting sometimes does not match the believable world.

I tried it, but it could not hold my attention.
Loading screens on the Switch are very long. 
The visuals of the game are really nice and unique. The gameplay is lacking, however.
Overall the game is very easy and brings nothing new to the table of the Tower Defense games. It lacks QOL features, as it is very slow and you cannot speed up the game. You have to collect the gold that enemies drop with your character, which gets very tedious quickly.

Fear and paranoia are merged within two entwined stories told a century apart and tell a gripping tale of horror, madness, and dark, forgotten secrets.  Explore the ruins of Blackstone, make your way through dark and dangerous caves, solve devilish puzzles, and make your way to an exciting conclusion.  Dare you come face to face with The Beast Inside?

The Beast Inside mixes a fascinating story with a survival horror experience which I found engaging and interesting throughout the entire game.  The world was stunning, the tale remarkable, and the action was quite gripping—all leaving a pleasant taste in my mouth well after the end credits rolled.

The landscape of The Beast Inside looks like an open world but it really is not.  The lush and highly detailed world has paths that you must follow with fences, fallen trees, or other obstacles preventing you from straying too far.  However, for this type of game I did not see it as a detriment and there is still plenty of the dangerous and beautifully crafted decrepit woodlands and ruins to explore.

The voice acting is well done and the music and background sound really helped set the tone of the story.  Additionally, the amount of darkness in The Beast Inside made the game atmospherically perfect when coupled with a dwindling supply of oil for your lamp as your only source of light.

As a note, if you are a completionist and working on getting all of the achievements’ you will need to play this game at least four times so as to get all four of the different story endings.  This was the only drawback to the achievement system that I experienced since both the automatic storyline and the secondary achievements were relatively easy and fun to get and gave me a real sense of accomplishment.  Additionally this game has some severe jump scenes, some of which still got me even on the fourth and final playthrough.

The Beast Inside is an exciting take on thriller and survival horror with very few drawbacks.  Overall, I enjoyed the game and would recommend it to those interested in horror games with a splash of deviously devilish puzzles to solve while you engage in a terrifying journey into horror.

It's a rogue-lite where you complete runs and defeat bosses to get upgrades. The mechanics are really fun. Youre very mobile and have a hand cannon plus a few power ups. Theres a decent variety of enemies and rooms. 
The game looks and sounds great. Nice pixel art and retro aesthetic. 
My main issue with the game was just that I found it really hard. I hardly ever play these kind of games so had a steep learning curve and it definitely felt like a bit of a grind at times.

This game is a great update to the original Pac-Man formula. It has 100 unique levels, 3 unique enemy types and several items with different effects. It's good for single or multiplayer gaming. But it's hard. The enemies move a little too fast, and some enemies are a little to effective for casual play. This makes the levels, which are often design as a basic puzzle, very hard to complete. Since you start with very few lives shared among all players game overs are common.

There are several sections to the game, each with a number of levels. But if you get a game over, you must restart from the beginning of that section with 4 lives, making progress very hard. This is especially true when playing co-op. I reached out to the developer and suggested he add casual and beginner modes to make it easier to play with casual friends. He seemed to think this was a great idea and implied he was working on it.

It's a very hard game and good for seasoned gamers to play single player.

The versus mode is also a lot of fun, where you chase down your friends. You cannot camp on the last gold coins since the game timeouts and give the victory to the treasure hunters. It's funt and frantic.

𝟖,𝟓/𝟏𝟎 👏
One of the best co-op games. I don't really like extinguish fire but after playing it with friends and advancing beyond the 1st level, I realized that I had found a rare diamond. Each level has 5 additional game modes+there are additional tasks that are available in all these modes, which creates an incredible replayability for the game, for completing tasks you get money, coins and diamonds that you can spend on really interesting equipment. Embr is an example of just a perfect grind game. I bought 4 copies and played with a bunch of friends, I got a lot of fun, and there is also a plot in the game, the locations are always surprising with something, they are interesting to study, a lot of hidden bonuses at the levels, the game is made from the heart, despite its primitiveness. There are, of course, small drawbacks, such as the weak design of the game, which do not allow to rate 10/10, I complete 2 areas on 100% for about 35 hours and I wanted more, but 3 district became a disappointment for me, the authors could not do better than the second masterpiece district and 3rd turned out to be quite average, 2 levels with a rate of 6/10 for me, 1 level - 7.5 and 1 - 7, final mission and ending..also 6/10. Only the third district does not allow me to rate the game 9/10.

Эм, ну что сказать, лучшая гриндилка всех времён!) Не, ну если серьёзно, то одна из лучших кооперативных игр, заслуживающая онлайн наровне с каким-нибудь Payday 2. Я купил игру просто посмотреть с большим сомнением, мне не очень нравится тушить пожары, но поиграв в неё с друзьями и продвинувшись дальше 1-ого уровня я понял, что нашёл редкий алмаз. У каждого уровня есть 5 доп. режимов+есть доп задания, которые доступны во всех этих режимах, что создаёт у игры просто нереальную реиграбельность, за выполнение заданий вы получаете деньги, коины и алмазы, которые вы можете тратить на действительно интересное снаряжение, с первого раза изучить новый уровень не получится, вам придётся играть на одному уровне больше 6 раз и это очень круто, это вот тот тип гриндилок, где ты не против гринда, потому что разработчики говорят тебе гриндить, но взамен дают новый режим, Embr - пример просто идеальной гринд-игры, тут практически нету раздражающего гринда, когда надо проходить прям одно и тоже, игра даёт тебе кучу вариантов пройти одну локацию немножко по-другому, прям совсем гринд будет если вы захотите скупить весь магазин игры, чтобы сделать все достижения, но от этого мало смысла, поэтому тут уже будет ваш личный выбор+Ко всему игра мало весит, нетребовательная, по скидке не очень дорого стоит, её базовый геймплей не сложный, я купил 4 копии игры за около 1100 рублей и играл с кучей друзей, я получил кучу удовольствия и фана, причём в игре ещё есть и сюжет, локации всегда чем-то удивляют, их интересно изучать, куча запрятанных бонусов на уровнях, игра сделана прям с душой, несмотря на её примитивность. Есть конечно и небольшие минусы вроде слабого дизайна игры, которые не позволяют поставить ей 10/10, но игра сделана с душой, в ней куча всего интересного, я прошёл 2 района на 100% где-то около 35 часов и я хотел ещё, но третий район получился у разработчиков очень средним, они не смогли превзойти свой шедевриальный второй район, в итоге 2 финальных уровня на 6, 1 на 7.5 и 1 на 7, финал и концовка тоже на 6, что не позволяет мне поставить игре 9/10.
