Histoire en trois chapitres/lieux avec des énigmes classiques à résoudre.
Peut être jouer en famille voire en mode 'mon premier point'n click' :)

Durée très courte (~2h) donc à prendre en promo.
A conseiller aux amateurs du genre.
Great game! Very amazing graphics and an immersive atmosphere, if you have a great PC I suggest playing this amazing game!

Very biased in this review as I love dinosaurs. It's very fun going around the ark and knocking out creatures to tame and ride around on. Can be very chill (when breeding and farming) to very hectic and adrenaline filled (bosses and swamps). My most played game of all time.

reviews.title: alperozgunyesil's review of Lost in Random

reviewText.content:
I started the game a coincidence, you know you can reach it via Game Pass. Somehow, I haven't seen it before. What a beautiful encounter it was! In every pass, the game managed to surprise me with the skills of its creators. Sound effects, music, characters, textures, puzzles, VO performances, environment, puns! 
It was like living in Nightmare Before Christmas for a while. And they made it a pretty original way, you can feel the inspiration but it's blended in with their unique approach. 
Text-based puzzles (like "rhyme battle" with Royam) were in my favorite moments. This kind of footwork and their sharp sense of humor reminds me of the good old adventure games. I definitely demand more! <3
Every phase of it made me say "ah how creators loved this game" You can feel it. Yes! It has flaws. Some control problems, some pace issues of the flow, some unvoiced moments of the main character (Even) can take you away from the zone... But everytime like that, i said "i wish they had more time and money" because they definitely can create amazing things with the opportunities of the mainstream has... For the first time in my life, I wanted to congratulate EA Games to support this beauty.

If you are not a big fan of grotesque as mine you can make it 1-2 stars less. But it won't change the fact of how beautiful this game is <3 

I finished it, and i know I'll be back someday to feel it again.

P.S. So hard to save your skin from the hands of Kiss em before you toss em. Wonderful song! 

P.S.2 Slim: My English is not enough to write a compliment in this complexity, but i hope you understand.

"Lake" is more than just a visual and auditory escape; it's a homage to the joys of simple living and the beauty of taking a moment to breathe. The game's art style, with its soft pastels and warm hues, complements the serene soundtrack that echoes the tranquility of the setting. It's a digital detox, a respite from the cacophony of the modern world, inviting you to savor the calm and collect moments of introspection.

reviews.title: In addition to the visuals, there is a very cool and rich combat system, also with elements of platforming, which is cramped in such a childish game, overloaded with dialogues and loadings

reviewText.content:
But TMNTU also stands out for its fairly good, smooth combat mechanic, a fairly diverse number of techniques, combinations, rolls that you want to repeat over and over again, "AHEARTFULOFGAMES" was hired for the development, responsible for a tiny indie beatemup, and apparently they approached the matter with all their heart, if you play some old projects about the carriers of the shells of the 2000s or even 2010s - all the mechanics there were much more crooked than in "Mutants Unleashed", believe me,
Also here Arenas and transitions between them use platforming, but it's too little to make a revolution in the genre, and somewhere it's inconvenient because of the fixed camera, if you're hoping for a full-fledged level like Tony Hawk with sliding along the railings, then, alas, all the maps are small boxes, and btw with a lot of backtracking, but this isn`t particularly noticeable, since the beginning and end of the map often change places,
In short, my main thought about the game is that the combat system is literally constricted here, the target audience for the publisher is children, so they left no chance to reveal the potential, the enemies are too easy, so much so that you will get rank S in 99.9% of cases, without even having time to warm up your fingers, there is, of course, a small progressionespecially when mobs that shoot lasers appear, but you are unlikely to endure 5 tedious hours for the sake of a little difficulty at the end. Even with the bosses, things are uneven, the first one is very difficult, and the last one is click-killing in a minute, in terms of mechanics it's standard dodges from circular damage and a lot of hp, nothing special,
And in short.. there's another fundamental problem: someone came up with the idea to stretch such a simple game, putting it in the shell of some Japan-RPG.. Like time after time we have to start missions from our sewer hub, or before the task go to the gym or office.. like a place where our friends are waiting for us, which opens up a new level of upgrades for one of the turtles just for dialogues, like in a visual novel ) And here there is also a day and night system and restrictions on completion by days. There are a couple more things like in the arcade you can take a modifier for 1 run to increase damage or for additional life (when you die, you return to the map), you can go through optional missions to find infected enemies.. which then for some reason will open up infected everywhere. There is also a pizzeria, where several unsuccessful platform levels for speed are available, and at home there are dojo challenges.. damn, there is also a smartphone there, you can read notes with it and scan the area for some goodies that are not used anywhere, as well as coins and cassettes, found on the main levels - In general, all this is so unnecessary, it kills the pace of the fighting game if anyone forgot..
These cutscenes-dialogues about nothing with anthropomorphic animals from films begin to seem endless, fortunately they add the ability to skip them, but even so, the soul is exhausted by the minute-long loading between 3-minute levels. The content of the story also doesn`t affect the films, there everything is at the level of experiences of secondary characters like Bebop and Rocksteady disappointed in people, became bad, but we convinced them and "changed their shoes".. well, and some villain scientist spreads a virus at the end.. and I won't remind you about cheap animations, everything is clear here,
And with aaall this, the game is not without the usual bugs, the most critical - because of which I cannot recommend the Cooperative game mode for 2 players (for which the camera is not adapted) - this is if you cross the checkpoint script before your friend, then you will immediately be separated by an invisible wall, because of which you will have to go back in order to then go forward together, and the passage back will again be frozen by the "wall" - who did this for what reason..

😊 𝗦𝘂𝗯 𝘁𝗼 𝗺𝘆 𝗦𝘁𝗲𝗮𝗺`𝘀 𝗖𝘂𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗼𝗿`𝘀 𝗽𝗮𝗴𝗲: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41977550
//
Понятно, что к дешёвым играм по кино-лицензии невозможно относиться серьёзно, обычно их делают будто просто для галочки,
Для "Черепашки-ниндзя: Мутанты на свободе" это тоже релевантно, но лишь отчасти, Во-первых любопытно как быстро начали развивать вселенную нового фильма (летом ещё неплохой сериал вышел), и, естественно, главным столпом является скопированный с Паука сел-шейдинговый визуал,
Но также в TMNTMU можно выделить достаточно хорошие плавные механики боевой системы, достаточно разнообразное количество приёмов, комбинаций, перекатов, которые хочется повторять снова и снова, на разработку наняли "AHEARTFULOFGAMES" , ответственных за крошечный инди-битемап, и видимо, они и подошли к делу со всей душой, если вы поиграете в какие-то старые проекты по носителям панцирей годов 2000-ых или даже 2010-ых, то там всё гораздо кривее сделано, уж поверьте,
Также у нас тут Аренки и переходы между ними немного используют платформинг, но этого слишком мало, чтобы совершить революцию в жанре, а где-то это неудобно из-за фиксированной камеры, если вы надеетесь на полноценный уровень типо Тони Хоука со скольжением по перилам, то, увы, все карты маленькие коробочки, причём, кстати, с большим количеством бэктркинга, но это особо не заметно, т.к. часто начало и конец карты меняются местами,
Короче, в целом, главная мысль об игре у меня - что Боёвке буквально тесно, целевая аудитория для издателя детская, поэтому никакого шанса на раскрытие потенциала не оставили, враги слишком лёгкие, настолько, что вы будете получать ранг S в 99.9% случаев, даже не успев разогреть пальцы, есть, конечно, небольшая прогрессия, особенно когда появляются мобы, стреляющие лазером, но вряд-ли вы вытерпите 5 муторных часов ради небольшой сложности в конце. Даже с боссами неравномерно, первый резко сложный, а последний закликивается за минуту, но по механикам это стандартные увороты от круговых дамагов и много хепешки, ничего интересного,
И крч.. есть ещё одна фундаментальная проблема: кому-то пришло в голову растянуть такую простую игру, засунув её в оболочку Japan-РПГ какого-то.. Типо раз за разом мы должны стартовать миссии из нашего канализационного хаба, либо перед заданием заходить в спорт-зал или офис.. типо места, где нас ждут наши френды, которую открывают нам новый ряд прокачки для одной из черепах просто за диалог, как в визуальной новелле) Причём тут есть ещё система дня и ночи и ограничения на выполнение по суткам. Есть ещё пару приколов типо в аркадной можно взять модификатор на 1 катку на усиление урона или доп. жизни (а так при смерти возвращение на карту), можно пройти необязательные миссии на поиск заражённых врагов.. которые потом зачем-то откроют заражённых везде. Есть ещё пицеррия, где доступны несколько неудачных платформенных уровней на скорость, а дома есть додзё-челленджи.. блин, там ещё смартфон есть, вы можете им читать записи и сканировать местность для каких-то плюшек, которые нигде не используются, также как и монеты и кассеты, находибильные на основных уровнях - В общем, всё это настолько не нужно, убивает темп игры-файтинга вообще -то..
Эти катсцены-диалоги не о чем с антропоморфными животными из фильмов начинают казаться бесконечными, благо оставили возможность их скипать, но даже так душу выматывают ежеминутные загрузки между 3-минутными уровнями.
Содержательно история тоже не влияет на фильмы, там всё уровня переживаний второстепенных персонажей типо Бибоп и Рокстеди разочаровись в людях стали плохими, но мы их убедили и переобули.. ну и какой-то злодей учёный вирус распостраняет в конце.. и я не напоминаю ещё про дешёвые анимации тут все понятно,
Иии при этом всём игра ещё не лишена и обычных багов, самый критичный - из-за которой я не могу порекомендовать кооперативный режим игры на 2 человек (под который ещё и камера не приспособлена) - это если вы пересечёте чекпоинт-скрипт раньше друга, то вас тут же разделит невидимая стена, из-за которой придётся вернуться назад, чтобы потом вместе пойти вперёд, а проход назад опять заморозился "стеной" - кто вообще это сделал зачем..

🏆 В общем, если вы фанат черепах и обладаете огромным запасом терпения, то попробовать определённо стоит, всё-таки это Beat ’em up - устаревший жанр, не предполагающий чего либо кроме бездумного мочилова, и механически оно сделано прекрасно, не захочется отпускать пальцы с кнопок джойстика, если начать (конечно, лучше с ним).

😊 Поддержка подпиской: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/37365104

reviewText.content: Five Nights at Freddy's: Security Breach a buggy mess that i love because of the lore and the the bugs made it unique

Short but good. This game has a charming atmosphere and simple but very well executed levels. Graphics and sound are dripping in PS1 vibe. Toree has also a couple of special visual treats along the way... There's also a pretty good replayability, trying to speedrun it it's good fun.

I love platformer games for the way they show what a good game needs to be good: great gameplay, animation and level design, the rest is compliment. I'm glad to say Toree 3D does it right, and it's the living proof of why I love videogames.
Very interesting story, not very hard riddles, has some glitches

reviews.title: Yukisekisan's review of Streets of Rage 4

reviewText.content: Definitely suggesting this one if you've ever played any Streets of Rage for any amount of time. If not, you might as well be in for a real treat, I can't imagine what it would feel like to play with this weird 2D camera perspective in 2022, but mastering the combat and learning how to counter each enemy and boss is very satisfying and rewarding.

Le retour d'une franchise culte c'est toujours risqué, et pour le coup cette fois c'est réussi :)
Animation, graphisme, musique, ambiance générale, ... tout à l'odeur de l'époque de la première trilogie, mais en mieux/avec les attentes du moment.
Pour les amateurs du genre ou les nostalgiques de la franchise, ne pas hésiter à prendre le jeu !
NB : Joué en coop local à trois on se marchait parfois sur les pieds mais ca allait en se parlant, par contre à quatre ca aurait été compliqué je pense.

Joué sur SeriesX via le GamePass.

reviews.title: why9me69's review of Bandle Tale: A League of Legends Story

reviewText.content:
good game but the crafting is complicated af 
u may need hours just to craft 1 item which is requires a lot of farming and crafting another items with rly bad music and sounds make it a rly bad experience as a chilling game 
the game would be rly great if they made it like 10-15 hours not  35

Jeu narratif sous acide, notre personnage est un jeune musicien en quête d'affirmation de sa personnalité.
Pas d'énigme and co, il s'agit ici simplement de se balader dans les environnements et faire quelques QTE lors des concerts, le gameplay est donc limité, c'est avant tout narratif.
Les décors et l'ambiance sont simplement superbes, avec une DA et une animation qui font fortement penser au studio Zoink (Stick it to the man, etc.).
Les environnements sont bien renouvelés sur la vingtaine de chapitres du jeu, et l'histoire est simple et un peu perchée mais on arrive à suivre les grandes lignes.

Contrairement à "Genesis Noir" donc la narration est complétement décousue, on a ici une histoire plus cohérente, même si ca reste perché, avec des métaphores sur les codes monde musical.

Joué sur SeriesX via le game pass.

The game is good, it has some fun new mechanics and other improvements over the previous games. As for the 80s thing, it doesn't fit at all with this game, super forced, and the story is totally forgettable.

The horrible Deponia series will not go away. Even after concluding its trilogy with a fairly final ending, somehow the repulsive Rufus is back once more in Deponia Doomsday  to insult, demean and spoil your time. 

What a wretched turd of a game. The previous Deponia trilogy was an unpleasant point-and-click graphic adventure series of almost impressively diminishing returns, that descended ever further into embarrassing, tawdry, sexist and arguably racist crap. It’s a story about an unpleasant arsehole called Rufus, who lives on a trash planet that’s about to be destroyed, and dreams of reaching the idyllic floating city of Elysium. The three games ended on a purportedly unhappy ending that saw Rufus falling to his apparent death. Hard to find that particularly unhappy after suffering through three games with the repellent shit, but that’s the background to this fourth entry.

Rufus wakes up and realises that the tales of his being some sort of clone, of working alongside two of his identical-looking nemeses, and of having a girlfriend literally called “Goal” who has a reprogrammable brain implant he programs to remove all the “bitch” from her personality, were all apparently a dream, or at least a vision of the future. This, sadly, includes his eventual faux-noble sacrifice.

Once he’s come to terms with all of that, a time traveller shows up and breaks Rufus’s original inexplicable girlfriend Toni’s crystal glass collection. The entire first act of the game is spent agonisingly repeating the same humourless or outright repulsive sequences and collecting the same inventory objects as you are forced to reverse time (at least) twice to find a way to prevent the glasses getting broken. Opportunities for clever time travel gags, or Bill & Ted style planning, are all ignored. Instead, you’re dragged down the obviously reductive well of shite that the writers seem to find so infinitely hilarious.

Along the way you encounter a series of stereotypes for Rufus to insult, which leads to one particularly repellently transphobic sequence. There’s a large, gruff, hairy character in a bar, who makes some remark about how, “You’d see me in a pink dress before I’d…” etc. Cue Toni kicking the shit out of him for something, and his emerging from the bar in a pink dress, wig, and awkward make-up, clutching at his groin. This, we’re asked to enjoy, means she’s come to realise she’s a woman. But HA HA HA! She’s so hairy and manly, not like a lady one bit!

Rufus can insult her in a series of ways, but the key one is to point out that her legs are too hairy for her to be a woman (no, really), and then, through a convoluted and ludicrous sequence of puzzles that your brain would switch off if I tried to plot out, you get her some wax in exchange for her “ladyshave” electric razor. You know, so you can shave off the fake beard you stuck to a child’s face and then got covered in bees. (On top deliberately insulting portions, the game is so astonishingly thoughtless. On encountering the very first non-white character in the game, one member of a mixed-race couple moving into a house, Rufus’s only remark on looking at either is, “Huh, there goes the neighbourhood.” I’m sure it wasn’t meant specifically, but fuck me, how did no one flag it up as a problem?)

The resetting of the story means we get to enjoy more of the wacky back-and-forth banter between Rufus and his furious mechanic girlfriend Toni, as she accurately points out what a selfish bastard he is, and he complains about her “nagging”. But then… mother-in-law jokes! Her mother is fat like an elephant is fat! She’s a “harpy”! She’s so fat she couldn’t break bones from a long fall! It’s like being trapped inside a 1970s sitcom hell. You’d have to really stretch a muscle to be offended by any of it, because it’s so pathetic. The only rational reaction is to feel sorry for it. To feel sorry for people who find this the height of wit.

It might be possible to see all of that as an annoyance if the game underneath were solid. But continuing the downward spiral for the series, the puzzles are increasingly ridiculous and dependent upon random stumbling. You need a band to play a song, but a man nearby doesn’t want them to. So of course you need the underwire from the bra of our trans friend (to improve her bust, apparently), and a potato that then needs to be chopped in half, and you have to think, “I know, I’ll combine a chopped in half potato with some bra underwire, and that will make a pair of earmuffs.”

Or, as is obviously going to be the case for anyone other than the designer of the puzzle, you’re going to randomly click objects in your inventory together until something combines, and then stare at the screen with your mouth hanging slack that this exists in the universe. There’s no attempt to flag if you’re doing the right thing at the wrong time (which could be too early or too late given the time travel and, no hinting that you might need to make one irrational leap to succeed at another irrational leap you’re currently trying to make. No structure, no thought at all put into how a player is going to encounter such entirely random situations.

Every scene, despite being lusciously drawn and animated, is barren of things to do. Highlighting interactive objects is necessary because there are so incredibly few of them in busy backgrounds, usually only two or three things in any screen. It certainly reduces the time it takes to click everything on everything, but makes it no less tedious.

A puzzle in which you must create a red bar for a colourful xylophone, by, er, pulling a key from a piano with a pair of pliers, then putting the piano key through a machine that adds sausage skin to objects, then stealing a heating lamp and placing it somewhere else, then holding the key-wrapped-in-skin up to the lamp to turn it red. Despite being a piano key wrapped in cooked skin, it works perfectly well on a xylophone. Yup. That’s really the level we’re working at here. 

Clearly the Deponia series is loved by enough people for them to keep making more of them, so I’m sure this will be as gleefully received as the rest. But it’s a nasty, stupid, and most damningly of all, badly constructed adventure game. The animations and art are lovely as ever, the music’s great, most of the voice actors are decent enough, but good grief, please, no more. Just make it stop.

reviews.title: JustLukas's review of The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

reviewText.content: No game can ever replicate the feeling of playing Breath of the Wild for the first time. But Tears of the Kingdom came very close.
Amazing game, worth the wait. Very creative, a lot to explore, my GOTY. Very much recommend.

reviews.title: DingleDongle's review of The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

reviewText.content:
Forwarning: I was not a fan of the direction of Breath of the Wild. I'm sure this will circle the review in a more understandable light.

Tears of the kingdom is a direct sequel to Breath of the Wild. Whilst Breath of the Wild wasn't my ideal direction for the series, and I found a number of decisions questionable, for the most part many of these decisions were replicated in the came, and in most cases, the decisions were double-downed on. With the caveat of one which is that the game, still very open, gives more direction, with the main hub of the game. However, the durability system are addended to to make the durability feel even more lingering. On top of this, they add the new(?) throwable item system. which sounds great until you realize how stupid the controls are hold R, then hold up, then swipe the R analog to select the item, release up, and aim. Not too bad for an uncommon use but when you are using an item every ten steps in the depths. this can lead to some dexterous frustration.

The new mechanics craft and fuse. Really hinder the momentum of the game, craft forcing you to create designs for a couple of minutes, which you will usually use for 5-30 seconds, does not feel rewarding, especially given the further focus on air travel and it's increased utility. Fuse ends up increasing the complexity of the macro-management of weapons, scrolling through your weapons to diagnose which weapon could use the power boost for it's limited use. Recall and Ascend on the other hand feel like lazy design solutions, and trivialize much exploration of the sky and most importantly, the shrines. 

Shrines make a return and although there is a fair defense of bite-sized puzzles for breath of the wild. Shrines fall to even worse heights. Of the 90 or so shrines I faced It felt like 70 of them fell into either mechanic tutorials such as how to hit a headshot, or Zonai device tutorials, such as how to use a fan, or my favorite of the three, the 'I can just use recall and I'm not sure if that's the goal' shrines which feel incredibly unrewarding, not even realizing if I solved the puzzle. The dungeons of the game feel a little underwhelming and are realistically on par with those found in BotW with a nicer coat of paint.

Now onto some good parts and why despite this, I may enjoy the game a bit more then in BotW. First of all, the locations feel more friendly and active. This is due to the benefit of being a sequel but I don't hold that against them. The music also sounded better, I'm not sure if it was mixed better or it was just because I was enjoying the villages a bit more but there was a lot more appreciation for some of these pieces. 
One of my biggest gripes of the original was Overpowered the glider felt, and how it limited the ground exploration that you would like to have. With the increased mobility options in the sky and the themes of this game. Those gripes were wiped away leaving my moment to moment exploring feeling a bit more enjoyable.

There's so much to go over that I feel like I have to skip more of it but something I can't ignore is the performance. 98% of my playtime was docked and the performance dipped to a, not awful but offputting performance at least every hour. In some locations (some dungeons even) performance would hold under 20fps for minutes on end, making me feel a bit nauseous (Fire and Water Temples). This has been played off as a minor inconvenience by some critics but I disagree and am not willing to forgive because the switch is a less powerful console. This could have been fixed if you were given options to remove effects or draw distance. 

Overall I still enjoyed the game, it's easy to recommend to people who liked it's prequel but if you were like me and found BotW to be moving in the wrong direction, you should brace yourself for a similar experience. I can't say whether you'll enjoy it more, but I did. Even if I think technically it might be a bit worse.

reviews.title: tanli2020's review of The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

reviewText.content:
首先，游戏以其惊人的图形和细节呈现出一个栩栩如生的开放世界。每个地方都充满了细致入微的设计和华丽的风景，让玩家仿佛置身于一个奇幻的王国。从宏大的山脉到神秘的森林，从广阔的草原到古老的废墟，每个地方都展现出独特的魅力和探索的价值。

其次，游戏中的谜题设计精妙而富有挑战性，给玩家带来了令人愉悦的思考体验。无论是解锁隐藏的宝藏，还是通过巧妙操作来攀爬高峰或穿越危险的地下洞穴，每个谜题都要求玩家充分发挥智慧和创造力。这种挑战感让人沉浸其中，乐此不疲。

最令人难以忘怀的是游戏的故事情节。《塞尔达：王国之泪》以其复杂而引人入胜的剧情吸引着玩家。玩家扮演的主角与其他角色之间建立起真实而深刻的关系，每个角色都有自己的故事和动机。游戏中的情感元素、战斗场景以及玩家的选择和决策都将影响着整个王国的未来。这种交织的故事线使游戏充满了紧张感和情感共鸣。

此外，游戏还提供了丰富的探索和自由度。玩家可以自由选择自己的探险路径，发现隐藏的秘密、解开谜团，或者与各种NPC互动，参与各种任务和挑战。这种自由度为玩家带来了无尽的可能性，使每个人都能体验到独特的冒险旅程。

reviews.title: dariovaccaro's review of The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

reviewText.content:
As a massive BotW fan, I was a bit let down by TotK. Unlike the first game in the sub-series, I was not compelled to see and do everything, because much of what I saw and did felt like a repetition of what BotW was. Sure, the new powers are a technical marvel, and the story has a bit more bite than the previous one, but both have their problems. The powers are way too broken, so much so that as soon as you learn a few slightly more advanced tricks you end up cheesing most challenges. It seems to me like an instance of too much freedom without any checks to make the experience somewhat challenging. The story is both too similar to BotW's (the four shrines at the beginning, the four regional phenomena...) and incoherent with it (no spoilers, but think about where Zelda is supposed to be during the Calamity, given what we learn in this game). 

That said, I don't want to make it seem like I hated playing this game. I played for more than 80 hours and mostly had a blast with it. It's just not at the level of freshness and creativity that BotW introduced in the industry.

reviews.title: vlndk's review of The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

reviewText.content: Tears of the Kingdom took my breath away, even more so than Breath of the Wild.  The sheer freedom to experiment, create, and explore is unmatched. Every corner of Hyrule, both above and below, holds delightful surprises and engaging challenges.  The shrines and temples are clever puzzles, and the story, while familiar, tugs at the heartstrings in unexpected ways. I've lost countless hours wandering, building, and battling, and I can't wait to discover what else this world has in store.

reviews.title: From Slow Burn to Epic Adventure: A Dive into the Game That Won Me Over

reviewText.content:
My favorite thing about the first game was the pacing: them giving you access to the final boss at the start of the game and letting you run free felt soo nice compared to other open world RPGs. And this game compounds that with a 3x the size map essentially and a much more dynamic air travel system. On top of lots of QoL improvements, this game cuts the downsides of the first one and still feels different.

The depth of the new building system I think is largely up to how much of it you want to explore. It feels like most of the heavy building is left to shrines, while you can still make cool vehicles for travelling the open-world. And the sections where you do get deep into it, you get to use really cool building tricks to solve puzzles.

But the real highlight of this game for me was the flashy, complex combat. With all the new fuse combinations for weapons giving you access to burning, freezing, blowing, sleeping, stunning, exploding in any way you want, combat feels like a sandbox. The synergies between freezing and blowing someone off a cliff, smoke bombing a horde to plant bombs in their face, bomb-shielding in the air to rain hellfire arrows (which are now so much cheaper with fusing), it all just flows together like choreography. In the end, instead of feeling like other games where you just have bigger stats or weapons, the insane amount of options for combat you have make you actually feel like a god.

The first Headliner was a prep for this one. I am not going to lie, I really enjoyed this one. The chaos factor was off the charts, you never really know what the truth is, and choosing the articles with a certain angle gets more fun with time passed. The characters you interact with are interesting and have their own little side stories, to which you significantly contribute to. I do not usually replay games, but this one might be just worth it.

Как я и говорил, я вернулся в эту игру, чтобы посмотреть на нововведения, как оказалось они настолько малы, что это просто ужасно. В игре нечем заняться, спустя пару часов геймплея, карты заканчиваются и все, игру можно удалять, потому как делать тут больше нечего. Это, пожалуй, и будет первый минус игры - малое количество контента. Меня очень сильно удивляет разработчик игры, чем он вообще занят. Различные игровые шедевры, бывает, делают по 5-10 лет, и я как бы могу понять, создать огромный открытый мир, проработать сюжет, сделать интересные сайд квесты, это все сложно, и срок себя оправдывает. Эта же игра в раннем доступе с 2015 года, и ничего не меняется, разработчик очень ленивый, дизреспект ему за такую медлительность. Ну и последним минусом хочу выделить баги, ну это можно понять, ранний доступ. Единственный, пожалуй, плюс игры - это боевая система в совокупности со сложностью, потому как тут вам, как какому либо Бэтмену одной левой всех уложить не получится, тут вы понимаете, что вы такой же смертный, как и ваши враги.

reviews.title: kapodaco's review of Bug Fables: The Everlasting Sapling

reviewText.content:
I just finished my second playthrough of Bug Fables. Sometimes with games, especially those with a lengthy runtime somewhere around 20 hours or more, one needs to re-immerse themselves a second or third time to really appreciate them. Too much content can occasionally slip through the cracks of the subconscious mind, inevitably torn from the overall. To identify these aspects, and then to work on filling in what remains, is a crucial part of understanding what does and doesn't work.

On my initial playthrough, I complained that the visual and auditory elements of the game were somewhat paltry. That they did not compare, as is almost required to do, to its primary inspiration in Paper Mario. Yet now, I believe it's not exactly fair to view the existence of Bug Fables to be within the shadow of its inspirator. Where Paper Mario succeeds is not relevant. What is meant to be conveyed in this game, from fields both visual and audio, is different.

Even now, I don't think these qualities exceed that of Paper Mario—particularly The Thousand-Year Door—but not only do they work on their own merit, they work wonderfully. So many different tracks to convey the mood of the usually serene, occasionally harrowing, and minimally horrific sequences that permeate the journey. Catchy and memorable, captivating and invigorating. There is much that this game has to offer those fond of what was popularized, at least for some, from Nintendo's popular franchise.

Yet what really makes this worth playing is the effort in developing what probably should be required for any JRPG-esque adventure game: characters. Kabbu, Leif, and Vi, the three characters at the forefront of all that arises in the land of Bugaria, impress through their own individuality and goals. No character is without merit, nor are they going to veil themselves for the sake of plot or fan service or any other fluff. They are, ironically worded, people. All that makes up what we are, only in video-game form. Some may play Bug Fables because they "heard it was good" or "just want another traditional Paper Mario game again." Both valid as reasons, what those uninitiated may not realize is that the focus on these "people" make Bug Fables not only worthy, but superior to its inspirator.

If you adore Paper Mario, play this game. If you adore games that value the importance of relating to and empathizing with its cast, play this game. If you adore that feeling of dread that bubbles within, rising ever slowly as you sense the end drawing near—fear that you may not have much left to spend playing—play this game. Certainly not perfect, as would be expected from a smaller team of developers, yet it embodies all that makes video games great. I cannot recommend it enough.

reviews.title: shadow10568's review of Bug Fables: The Everlasting Sapling

reviewText.content: A charming game that takes inspiration from the old Paper Mario games but adds enough content to be something fresh. Bug Fables follows the journey of Team Snakemouth as they search for various artifacts to help them find the Everlasting Sapling, a mythical plant that can grant a bug eternal youth. The team includes Vi, an ambitious honey bee, Kabbu, an honorable beetle, and Leif, a level-headed moth. The team travels across Bugaria, a place with many different areas for the player to explore during their quest. During turn-based combat, the player has to press the button corresponding to the one shown on the screen to attack and block enemies. Special skills can deal even more damage to enemies. The game has a combat system that is fun and satisfying. The player can equip medals, similar to the badges in Paper Mario, that will activate unique effects in combat and the overworld to allow for custom playstyles and various strategies. The game has a loveable cast of characters with in-depth personalities that make the world of Bug Fables feel alive, and the protagonists face points of deep character development throughout the story. The game also has a plethora of sidequests and collectibles, allowing for gameplay beyond the main storyline. Overall, I spent countless hours on Bug Fables and loved every moment of the game. It's one of my favorites, and I believe that fans of RPGs and indie games should try it.

A cute puzzle game about connecting train cars to the locomotive.

That's all there is to it. Just a nice break from reality while you get to focus on the trains.

My first Telltale game. And I loved it! Choices are harder and impact the story dramatically. It is hard to write a story people care about and are able to influence it at the same time, otherwise, it would get boring really fast. This is not Batman: The Enemy Within's problem. The story flows, and you feel like a part of it. In this particular context, it takes a toll on the Batman universe, though: it is up to the player if Batman behaves like Batman, because your choices might reflect the opposite of his "canon" character.

The first episode really made me think that this game would not be a big think, just another generic superhero story with some shallow drama, but it really kicks later on. The way of developing the psyche of the Joker to make you actually feel something for a character so overused in the media was amazing to the point that I consider this my favorite version of the Joker so far (not including the comics here). We also get to see a lot more of Bruce Wayne, which feels really refreshing. The game has the usual Telltale flaws, but if you came this far (this game is a sequel, so I assume you played the previous one) you knew what you were getting into.

I really liked it initially for the story and the idea, but those Quick Time Events are just pretty stupid idea. Never liked them and I am not quite sure why someone thinks they are sensibleness for games. 
In any case you could disable some of them, but not all... if you miss a key you die and you have to start the game from scratch if you are not happy -  like Chinese grind fest game.
Oyunun videolarını izledim ama çok pahalı olduğu için alamadım ama izlediğim kadarıyla çok güzel bir oyun umarım uygun fiyata düşer

reviews.title: martinpt's review of The Dark Pictures Anthology: Man of Medan

reviewText.content:
For me the best one from the thriology !
I played with my friend we played every game from the saga and we still are in love with the first game !
Better jumpscares, better story, better characters and the gameplay is just incredible !

reviews.title: Man of Medan - A disappointing spiritual successor to Until Dawn

reviewText.content:
Again, SPOILER WARNING

Let's begin with the obvious: most gameplay aspects of interactive story-telling are identical in all games of the genre. Yes, this one is also mostly about slow-walking around interacting with the environment and partaking into dialogues that pretend like they're gonna change the story but usually don't, and doing thousands of irreversible quick-time events that may or may not unceremoniously kill off a character. So I will not consider any of these aspects flaws of this game in particular, so if you don't like this sort of game then you definitely won't change your mind on this one. Because of the aforementioned similarities in the genre, I can't help but base this review on why some similar games worked, and this one does not.

Going straight to the point: Man of Medan does not work because it misses the point on three key aspects this kind of game needs to be entertaining: characters, setting and story.

Telltale's The Walking Dead worked because it had extremely likeable protagonists you wanted to protect throughout the apocalypse. This genre requires a captivating crew to get you invested and want to see it to the end. Unfortunately in Man of Medan none of the characters are likeable, most of them having but a dust of individual personality. Throughout the story it feels like any two characters could have swapped positions and the story would've still been the absolute same. The only character that showcased a little bit of personality was Conrad (nicely portrayed by Shawn Ashmore), but in my initial playthrough I managed to help him escape as soon as the conflict started, leaving me with the rest of the boring cast for the entire rest of the story.

On another comparison, Until Dawn worked because of its diversity of areas and how self aware it was that it is the game equivalent to a generic slasher film. Still, it knows how to make you fear the unknown and subvert your expectations despite the stereotypes, be it the man stalking you around or the force of nature leaving its marks around the lodge. Man of Medan doesn't feel the same way.

The game mostly lock you down to this military cargo ship and fills it with all sort of random jump scares that you will hardly connect to a real threat to you, quickly generation a sense of sameness. It is easy to see how cheap the horror in this game is long before you figure out that all the horrors are a result of hallucinations created by the so called Manchurian Gold, but this twist makes you understand why, and it just adds salt to the wound. You concretely understand that there was never a real threat other than the pirates you met at the start of the game, and that most of what you're seeing isn't real. In short, the goal of the game  on the second half ends up being ignore everything "scary" and just keep walking around until you end up outside.

Après un until dawn perfectible mais qui posait les bases, voici la "suite".
Changement de décors mais pas de gameplay, les embranchements sont ici bien plus nombreux, ce qui paradoxalement fait perdre en lisibilité et complexifie la compréhension des cheminements.
Sur le fond l'histoire est sympathique sans plus, les animations et les voix VO et même VF pas trop mal réussies.
Sur la forme on est entre un film intéractif avec des QTE, et un jeu d'aventure/exploration. Les QTE revus ici par rapport à Until dawn sont je trouve moins bien réussis, notamment "les battements cardiaques" pénibles.
Au final un jeu sympa en multi local où on peut facilement se passer la manette pour jouer à plusieurs, le temps d'un RUN de découverte (5/6h?) puis de deux ou trois runs pour creuser les possibilités.
A noter qu'il est impossible de passer les cinématiques dans les autres runs une fois le jeu terminé, dommage car à 80-95% on refait la même chose.

(Joué sur SeriesX via le Game Pass)

Petit jeu à petit budget, on retrouve le même humour absurde et le même type d'animation volontairement artisanal et 'marionnettiste'.
Le jeu reste assez court malgré ses trois fins (une poignée d'heures), mais vu le prix réduit ca reste cohérent.
Le jeu niveau gameplay est du classique point'n click, rien de particulier.
Pas de souci sur la traduction sous titrée en Français qui fait bien son boulot.
Et à part une énigme un peu tordue le reste est très logique et 'fluide'.

Joué sur SeriesX via le game pass.

reviews.title: rollback_lothbrok's review of The Procession to Calvary

reviewText.content: I liked this point n click. Very cool, with a well measured humor (but not too much).

He has travelled the planet
And made all these new friends
Including the sweetest girl they call Goal.
But most dreadful of events
Unfold, and the challenges await
The hero, will he be up to test?
No doubt the third part is the best.
Huzzah, the third one's the best!

reviews.title: Bon épisode dans la continuité des précédents

reviewText.content:
Episode très long et bien complet, humour cynique toujours au top

La fin en elle-même aurait pu être plus longue et plus développée, mais elle reste correcte sans être inoubliable.

La durée de vie de ce 3eme chapitre m'a semblé être supérieure à celle des deux autres.

The game easily gets repetitive - already in the beginning.

You will need to spend your time, doing same things over and over, to earn some money for upgrades. Mechanics are simple, graphics are primitive.

There is a story/plot, which is kinda boring.

Different bugs - you can softlock yourself, Blood icon (which tells you to clean the floor, but you can't) etc; game also skips first part of every new dialogue.

Don't waste your time, try something else.

Beating cosmic ocean in this game is probably the hardest and most rewarding challenge I've ever overcome in a video game. The difficulty of the game feels mostly fair, with pretty much every death being the player's fault. I also love the art style of Spelunky 2. I think it can be one of the most beautiful games and every different environment feels alive. Especially cosmic ocean.

Great game. For those fans of things like Icewind Dale and Baldurs Gate, this game will sooth the old days itch for a bit. I spent a lot of time doing everything I could in this game. Even played it again for the platinum trophy. Great game.

Its pretty much the story mode for gang beasts. Some very fun and imaginitive puzzles. The gameplays good and the ragdoll weird characters are fun to mess around with. Theres a good variety of levels. I played through it all with a mate and we had loads of fun pushing the physics to see what we could get away with.

Human: Fall Flat is a great idea and a bad idea at the same time. The level design is good for what the devs/game designers were trying to achieve. But I cannot get over how Bob moves. Half the time you are trying to get Bob to do what you are intending to do. I get it, it's the game's main gimmick, and it is supposed to be funny, but to me, it's just frustrating. If it all was a tad bit easier to control, I would enjoy the game tremendously. I will keep trying, I just can't imagine finishing the game, if I consider the main mechanic a barrier to my fun.

Video game is one of greatest medium as learning tool in the digital age, whether it can be as history re-imagining in many fantasy video games or history revisionist based on the company agenda to re-write a piece of history for pandering. 1979 Revolution Black Friday is nor any of them. Its a tell-tale type of video games that shows the experience of the Iranian Revolution in 1979 based on real character and the history book.

There are not many things to do in Tell-tale video game except watching each chapters about the plot line where players play as civilian who happened being involved the mass protest who use his camera to capture the condition of Iranian society at the time, so players require to do bit exploring and take some snap-shot of pictures that resembles of real life photography. There are also minor action involving quick-time event in action sequence. 

The game is mostly presented through dialogue and many characters, some items are also becomes an additional fun fact about the background history. So, if you are interested in learning history especially Iranian revolution, you may check the game. 

The game also have a choice of dialogue that is mostly makes the difference outcome but it will be intertwined into the final ending that somehow a cliff-hanger but still I can learn some stuffs after playing the game and reading some texts related to the event and listening audio log.

Finished : 31 December 2019 
Written : 31 December 2019

reviews.title: fehbolaa's review of 1979 Revolution: Black Friday

reviewText.content: Duck Game is a fighting game, but everything just seems to click. the physics are very well done and the one-shot-kill mechanics make for reliable gameplay. The addition of advanced techniques with frame-perfect inputs provides a high skillcap so extreme gamers can continue playing and learning and having no life. the addition of custom hats, levels, and mods provides for great workshop content when you feel a little tired of the vanilla game. since 1.5 there will always be a public lobby available to just play and if that doesnt work for you there are a ton of advanced communities such as QC, FP, RDZ and HD. 10/10 would highly recommend.

reviews.title: Réalisation qui claque la rétine, mais solo décevant

reviewText.content:
Réalisation qui claque la rétine dès le premier combat, combos qui sortent tous seuls, personnages DB sans le Z présents (tenshihan, yamcha, etc.) ... le jeu met la barre très haut dès le début.
Sauf que personnellement, étant plutôt joueur solo, c'est très vite l'ennuie : le solo avec une notion de niveau pousse a utiliser toujours les mêmes persos et les combats sont vite TRES redondants, le mode arcade est un enchainement de combats sans histoire, et ensuite il y a les tutos et le jeu en ligne. Et c'est tout.
Le gameplay qui favorise les combos faciles pour les joueurs débutant / moyens donne lieu à des sessions ou un joueur (puis l'autre) enchaine ses combos laissant l'autre dans une attente énervant sans rien pouvoir faire.
Reste la technique irréprochable, et les DLC sympathiques.

Joué sur SeriesX via le gamepass.

renaissance pr buried one more game. they don't care, as they still have too many to bury.
don't share the game with journalists, don't deliver to curators, overprice the game, and then wonder why noone is playing it? what went wrong?

Toem is an all too short, but utterly charming and cozy little puzzle game built around that unique sense of discovery one gets while looking through the lens of a camera; an invention endowing its user with the incredible ability to transport oneself into these small moments amongst nature they would have otherwise missed. We're able to learn so much more about the world around us by allowing ourselves the opportunity to take in the scenery and examine the smaller details that comprise the "bigger picture"; Toem presents itself as an invitation to all of that.

Within the first few minutes of the game we're handed a camera, our companion throughout our travels, from small towns to mountain peaks, it's there to guide us; to tug at our sleeve and point at things in hope to provide us with a richer portrait of each community we pass through. Along the way we'll meet all sorts of eccentric characters; locals, tourists, or other adventurers, who might ask us for favors like searching for a suspicious man or challenging us to scavenger hunts.

Rarely are the puzzles too hard or the objects too difficult to find, but even if you are having trouble with a task or two, you're never required to finish all of them before you're able to move on to the next area, which is a nice way to allow the player to dictate their own sense of pacing regarding progression.

Though the game IS quite short, (it took me only about 3 hours to finish, and around 6 to 100%) the charming atmosphere, soothing music, and unique presentation are more than enough to make up for it in my opinion, and it's an easy title to recommend anyone pick up in the event of a discount.

8/10

reviews.title: Petit jeu bien pensé, très malin dans son gameplay :)

reviewText.content:
Les énigmes sont toutes basées sur des photographies à prendre, plus ou mains faciles à trouver ou prendre.
Le noir et blanc ne pose pas de problème de lisibilité, et est plutôt reposant pour les yeux.
Le jeu ne manque pas d'humour, et les 6 villes à visiter sont variées (village, centre ville, station balnéaire, village de ski, l'île du DLC).
Compter environ 10h pour le jeu et son DLC inclus gratuitement.

Joué sur Xbox SeriesX via le game pass.

Extremely charming, easy to pick up and learn, and very addicting. A bit short, but doesn't overstay its welcome. The difficulty is great - it is not terribly difficult to advance and progress, but it is very hard to complete everything in the game, which is a source of some frustration. Regardless, Toem is a fantastic surprise I wholeheartedly recommend.
Deffently the best game in the series. Great story, combat and visuals definitely a must play for Batman fans.

* 7 June 2021 * less than 7, for some reason didn’t like in the end as much as I liked Origins, although Asylum felt better at first. Maybe because it is more childish/comic’ish/older + and I realized that Batman has mental problems: him not killing anyone started to irritate. * Finished in 2 days I guess. I thought that by 2009 they would know better than to use THAT batman outfit, simply cringe.

reviews.title: adamqq468's review of Batman: Arkham Asylum

reviewText.content: Great story, but it gets little bit repetetive but on the other hand missions and boss fights are getting harder.

Arkham Asylum is a remarkably crafted game, Batman is not just about throwing punches, it's about being a clever predator that stalks its prey carefully and uses the environment around at advantage. You have to carefully think of your next move as each one of the Joker's henchmen are taken out into the shadows. Of course there will be times that you will require to perform hand-to-hand combat, and I am pleased to tell you the system is very refined with windows of opportunity to evade hits and parry, it is always very satisfying when these are connected successfully. As you progress, your arsenal will grow with further tools and tricks to make your way through the grounds go smoother, including explosives, hooks, and other enhancements.

The asylum is full of secrets and collectibles, there are tidbits of information about the former and current residents of the mental sanitarium which very often are the pantheon of villains that Batman has had to encounter through the many decades of multimedia presence, sometimes they even make surprise appearances as well.

Possibly the only complaint I have about the game is the obnoxious final fight against his archnemesis in which it transforms into an odd game of all brawn and almost no wit; but I digress, it is still a marvel of design well worth every penny.
I played the game for a couple of hours mostly because of the beautiful graphics and the funny dialogues but it gets repetitive after a short while.

Hola a todos los jardineros/as que ya disfrutan de este simulador y que espero se sumen nuevos.
Garden Live  es un simulador de jardinería donde, como es de esperar, tienes que cuidar un jardín desde cero. Tienes que plantar los distintos tipos de plantas, las cuales, al igual que en la vida real, tienes que podar para su bienestar, para los encargos que te van llegando, vender tanto en forma de ramos como sueltas. Iras obteniendo semillas de ellas y nuevas especies de la misma planta(de otros colores)
Vas poder elaborar tu propio fertilizante para poder echárselo a las plantas y que estas, crezcan mejor.
Tendrás tú propio puesto de venta como dije antes, con el que ganas monedas para comprar nuevos utensilios de jardinería, semillas, adornos. Para ello, tendrás que ir a la plaza del pueblo.
Como en todo jardín, tus plantas/flores tendrán la visita de desagradables plagas, pero tranquilo, podrás usar un pequeño fumigador que cada vez que se vacíe podrás volver a llenar fácilmente.
Y como en la vida real, también pasaras por las 4 estaciones del año.
A medida que vayas avanzando y ganando dinero, iras desbloqueando cosas, zonas. Pero eso ya lo iras descubriendo según avances. 
Si tenemos que hablar fuera de lo que es el juego, en plan diseño, jugabilidad; hay que decir que visualmente es precioso. Diseño ambiental, los personajes, el doblaje(en mi caso, el español), a mi parecer son detalles muy cuidados, hechos con cariño.
La verdad, que ahora mismo, sabiendo que esta recien sacado al mercado de los videojuegos y sobre todo al mundo de la simulación, no le veo contras,  y si los hay no son comparables con los pros.
Pero si sigo, no dejaría cosas que el resto de futuros "jardineros/as" puedan descubrir.

It's really difficult to explain why I like this game. I am pretty sure many people found it boring considering the amount of silent parts in the videos. Nonetheless, after checking out some videos I started to get to know the characters better. It made me want to find out more about them.

Avec un moteur de recherche et 170 extraits vidéos, l'objectif du jeu est de reconstruire les liens et évènements entre les personnages (4 principaux et une quinzaine de secondaires).
Les vidéos sont des conversations webcam ou des enregistrements façon caméra de surveillance, les mots clefs du moteur de recherche étant cherchés dans l'ensemble des sous titres (les voix sont en VO anglaise).
Le nerf de la guerre ici est le jeu des acteurs, parfaitement professionnel (mention spéciale à la petite fille) ; on cherche ensemble à assembler le puzzle des évènements pour comprendre l'histoire.
Le gameplay est donc original mais aussi très épuré ; l'interface permet de taguer les vidéos et faire des recherches rapides en direct sur les sous titres.
Seul point lourdingue : les vidéos démarrent du mot clef qui a permis de les trouver => pour démarrer la vidéo depuis le début il faut rembobiner à chaque fois.
A jouer de préférence en longues sessions de jeu plutôt qu'en courte sessions pour bien rentrer dedans et enchainer les recherches, chaque vidéo donnant de nouvelles pistes.

Joué sur PC via le game pass.

You know how when you first start a rhythm game you have to really read into the visual indications and cues, but then you slowly start feeling the mechanics, and you just mostly listen with the visual cues being a secondary hint? This never happened with this game.
I generally disliked both its visual design and mechanics, the lack of feedback when pressing the notes versus when you miss them. I wouldn't advise against playing it if you're normally into rhythm games, but I wouldn't suggest this to someone looking to play a good rhythm game.

Gorogoa is all about puzzles, if there was any story-line there, I didn't get it. I played it on a Mac but it felt from the start that it belongs to an ipad. The puzzles are very innovative indeed and a little bit challenging, but still It took me less than 3 hours to finish the game, which is not a lot. I liked Gorogoa but I find the overwhelming positive reviews a little bit too much. I always rate using comparative evaluation with regards to other similar games I've played, so I decided a 6/10 for Gorogoa, which is a good rating in my personal (strict) evaluation scale.

Sympathique jeu de puzzle zen, joliment dessiné et animé, avec un gameplay original.
Quelques énigmes demandent à se creuser la cervelle mais rien d'insurmontable, en prenant le temps de se poser et de faire quelques essais pas toujours fructueux, on arrive forcément à trouver la solution :)
D'une durée de vie d'une poignée d'heure, un petit jeu rafraichissant entre de gros AAA parfois stressants.

Joué sur SeriesX via le game pass.
good game

Killer Frequency is an interactive fiction, you know: simple controls; talk to different characters in a linear adventure with decisions that will have a certain weight on the plot; duration about 4/5 hours and nice and simple graphics, in this case using cell-shading.

In my opinion, and I imagine we all agree here, the important thing in this genre is the story. The premise here is what led me to buy it, you are a radio host, there is a murderer in the town and you must try to help people through the station. We will have some humor, drama in varying proportions and an occasional surprise.

In general, the game is interesting, the story is set in the eighties, it is entertaining and interesting and is very reminiscent of the slashers that we have seen so many times in the cinema, including several nods to some of these films. In fact, the game in general feels like a small ode to said genre (including its voice acting, which sometimes delights and sometimes fails to convince).

As a negative point I would say that upon completing it you keep thinking that although it is a good game, it feels partly wasted. Our decisions influence 6, 7 times, but after finishing it in every possible way I see very little diversity, and taking into account its short duration it would be interesting to have a greater variety of conversations, calls or endings.

Even so, its premise is interesting and it is appreciated that it continues to try to give freshness to this genre. I have enjoyed it a lot and I think it is a recommendable game for anyone who likes this type of adventure. 7/10

Greetings.

It's really neat to walk around Lego worlds and see all the neat stuff the designers hide around each planet. It's fun running around and seeing the sights. I sometimes find progression hard and small randomly generated planets at the start sometimes glitch in ways that make it hard to complete. But you can always delete them and try a new one. It also took me time to realize how to generate a planet of a different type than the previous planet.

Fun for the small price, but I haven't played it much since the most recent patches, and haven't progressed to larger planets.

Possibly the best Worms game to date. Team17 listened to the fans criticizing new direction of the series (Battlegrounds, for instance), and went back to the basics from the times of Worms World Party and Worms Armageddon. The result is truly spectacular, even with new additions of some game-play mechanics. 30 campaign levels are great, and the last 5 are extremely hard, but not unfair - you have got to be very skilled to make it. I can't wait for another Worms installment.

You are Renée, a young woman who was a patient in a psychiatric institution in the 1940’s.  Through her memories and thoughts you begin to understand more about what happened to her and through exploring the dilapidated building in which she revisits you uncover more about the unsettling Town of Light.

This game features some amazing and oftentimes disturbing visuals of both the three-dimensional world and the two-dimensional memories that you experience.  The mental institution is real; the Ospedale Psichiatrico di Volterra psychiatric hospital in Tuscany was in operation from 1888 to 1978 and was known for the brutal treatment of its inmates.  This real-life location and the sad history behind this institution make for the backdrop of this terrifying examination of insanity, memory, and the treatment of mental patients in the not-so-distant past.

The Town of Light is not really a game.  There is a lot of walking from place to place and completing simple tasks given to you…such as find this or do this.  However, this game has a lot of world to explore and, with the beautifully rendered buildings and surrounding area, exploration is fun and stimulating.  In essence, The Town of Light is simply a visual story that you take part in as the player.

This game is bleak and unblinking and not for everyone.  Even though The Town of Light is a fictionalized version of the hospital and one inmate’s tale; it still touches on some very scary and disturbing elements of a sad history.  However, the journey is one that, should you decide to take part in, explores many concepts of this subject matter and leaves you with the memory of Renée’s tale in The Town of Light for quite some time.

Very nice style and setting. I felt as though it didnt quite deliver what it couldve though. The puzzles and platforming werent very complicated. The mini games kind of just annoyed me (why am i playing flappy bird?!). And the story didn't get as deep as i was hoping, mainly because the game only takes a couple of hours. That said it does have a lot of charm and if its on sale definitely worth picking up (i wouldnt put down the £10 its at currently).
Honestly I was expecting more of a limbo type adventure, but it wasnt on that level of darkness at all. If anything its quite a sweet and story.

How this game is very positive on steam, is beyond me. The game is bad in every aspect, except for the art. Yes it's made by one dude, but that doesn't excuse all of the flaws of this piece of software. It's about an hour long, but it has been stretched to two hours by forcing you to go back and collect 300+ items. Also, the controls are awful, the story is just bad and there are these stupid puzzles. One of them was just a rip off of flappy birds.

I'm loving Pan-Pan so far! I'm absolutely terrible at puzzle games, so I've been taking it slowly, and it's helped me see all the little charm the game has to offer! Everything from the various simple character interactions to the flowing, interactive system-base music really makes this game flow smoothly and wonderfully.
Another cool phone simulator game. If you like stories that talk about politics and revolutions, Replica won't disappoint you.

Perhaps an even greater disappointment then Call of Cthulhu.   Not a horrible game but definitely not what i thought it would be.  The creatures are interesting at first but quickly become repetitive. The game mechanics/innovations such as utilizing deductive reasoning in order to come to conclusions is an interesting idea but i feel that it does not fulfill its potential.  The story is well written but the NPCs themselves quickly become drab and feel less-than-human when compared to the various NPCs that populate games such as those in the Dishonest and GTA franchises. While playing i often found myself underwhelmed, bored, and utilizing a trainer and turning on "superspeed" simply to get to the next point of interest in a reasonable amount of time.  The city itself is repetitive and the graphics seem outdated.  I really wanted this to be great and would have been okay with it being decent but its not decent...its whatever. i am going to end up shelving it before finishing it and that's a damn shame and waste.   After Call of Cthulhu's less then spectacular release and now this, i fear the time has come to give up on Lovecraft ever directly making it to the realm of gaming in a respectable and worthwhile way.  That being said, LovecraftIAN games (Dead Space franchise comes to mind) still seem to hit the mark from time to time and but i will regardless need to start keeping my expectations in check with regards to anything having to do with cosmic horror.

reviews.title: thecrowspain's review of The Sinking City

reviewText.content:
The Sinking City is a failed attempt (another one) to bring Lovecraftian horror closer to video games but it fails miserably by including a very poorly designed and frustrating third-person action, investigation mechanics that end up being repetitive, and an almost complete inability  to create terror or tension in the player.

In my opinion, it is not a recommended game unless you want to play absolutely everything that has something to do with Lovecraft.

6.5 to 7/10 light action-RPG but completing it while having fun in co-op with little members of my family while they first discover button mashing doesn't work and they needs to have tactics easily makes this a 8/10. When asked how much they rate it from 1 to 10, they said: 100,000.

It could've been a really nice game, it really could, but instead it's early alpha build is sold as a complete, finished game. At the moment this review is being written it cannot be finished even with all latest patches and, truth be told, with such a beginning I personally won't bother to try it even once all critical bugs are fixed.
Too glitchy to play, though shows enough promise and originality to return to after a while. It reminds of 'King of the Dragon Pass' too much to, well, pass.

𝟕/𝟏𝟎
I don’t even know what to say about this game, other than the fact that it’s not boring, and that’s probably the main thing,
The gameplay consists of 2 tiny locations, each of which we move on a skateboard with the most casual but enjoyable platforming - to talk to someone or go to the store to buy something or prepare Power ups on our kitchen, playing a simple turn-based QTE game, The mechanics of skateboarding itself is also not as simple as it might seem at first, you will gradually be given mini-tasks to collect all the icons in a certain time for a record or even to perform tricks, it`s can provide a small challenge for fans of the genre,
The whole point here is in simple turn-based battles with your exes in the story or with your local suitors in an open location (for xp-farming), where you need to guess what type of “provocation” will evoke emotions in the enemy so that you can inflict more damage on him with special attacks, there is an also an ultra-move like “call mom” or aunt, and, naturally, you have 3 characteristics that affect the likelihood of success in attacks which are upgrading along with your level or automatically depending on your choices,
and with the help of the above-mentioned “replayable” activities at the location, you can accumulate coins for all outfits, get the S rank everywhere, establish relationships with all the characters - this explains the price tag of the game, there is about 15 hours of “platinum” content here, personally, I completed the game for free on Xbox Game Pass in 6-8 hours.
The animations seemed a little crooked to me, but the authors managed to make every move, every jump on a skateboard aesthetically pleasing, the overall “cel-shaded” visual are also not bad, so the game is simply pleasant to play, even if you are not interested in the plot about a bunch of evil, different-gender exes and finding out what you were guilty of, although sometimes there are funny lines in the dialogues, in general the battles here are more like an interactive visual novel, with good emotional voice acting by the way, and, well, a family drama about the difference between generations, a tyrant grandmother and sister`s faults is also present here , but more in the end.
Of course, I expected a little different from the creators of the conceptually good “Falcon Age” (where we traveled around the world from 1st person with a falcon-pet), I can’t say that the result was something outstanding, but it`s definitely something unusual, including gameplay points, “Outerloop Games” made another good game, it’s worth a try if you’re ready for experimental projects (although the developers could do without mentioning vulgarity in places, authors, come on).

Check my Annapurna Top: https://www.backloggd.com/u/grihajedy/list/publisher-annapurna-interactive/
//
Даже не знаю, что сказать про эту игру, помимо того, что она - не скучная, и это, наверное, главное,
Геймплей состоит из 2 малюсеньких локаций, по каждой из которых мы перемещаемся на скейтборде с максимально Казуальным, но приятным платформингом - чтобы с кем-то поговорить или зайти в магазин закупиться или приготовить Пауэр-апы на кухне, играя в простенькую пошаговую QTE-шку, сама механика скейтбординга тоже не так проста, как может показаться поначалу, вам будут постепенно открываться мини-задания на собирательство всех иконок за определённое время на рекорд или даже на выполнение трюков, это уже не слишком просто, и способно предоставить небольшой челлендж для любителей жанра,
Главный же замес тут в простеньких пошаговых боях с вашими бывшими по сюжету или с радомными ухажёрами на открытой локации (для фарма опыта), где вам надо угадывать какой вид "провокации" вызовет у врага эмоции, чтобы вы могли нанести ему больше урона спешиал атаками, есть ульта типо "вызова мамы" или тётушки, и, естественно, у вас есть 3 характеристики, которые влияют на вероятность успеха в атаках, которые прокачиваются вместе с вашим уровнем или автоматически в зависимости от ваших действий,
а с помощью выше уже перечисленных "реиграбельных" активностей на локации вы можете накопить валюты на все наряды, выбить везде ранг S, наладить отношения со всеми персонажами - это объясняет ценник игры в 1000 рублей, контента на "платину" тут часов на 15, я же прошёл игру бесплатно в Xbox Game Pass часов за 6-8, и то скипая половину диалогов.
Анимации мне показались немного кривоватыми, но у авторов получилось сделать каждый мув, каждый прыжок на скейтборде - эстетически приятными, общий "цел-шейдинговый" визуал тоже неплох, поэтому в игру просто приятно играть, даже если вам неинтересен сюжет про кучу злых разногендерных бывших и выяснения в чём вы были виноваты, хотя иногда в диалогах есть забавные реплики, вообще бои тут больше похожи на интерактивную визуальную новеллу, с хорошей эмоциональной озвучкой кстати, а, ну и семейная драма про разницу поколений, бабушку-тирана и сестринское кидалово тут тоже присутствует, но уже больше в концовке.
Я, конечно, ожидал немного другого от создателей концептуально неплохой "Falcon Age" (где мы путешествовали по миру от 1 лица с ручным ястребом), не могу сказать, что получилось что-то выдающееся, но что-то необычное, в том числе и с геймплейной точки зрения, у "Outerloop Games" определённо получилось, стоит попробовать, если вы к готовы к экспериментальным проектам (хотя можно было и без отсылок на пошлости обойтись местами, авторы, ну за шо).

This was my 2023 year-ender and 2024 new year's game, and it came at such a perfect time since I'm going thru a break-up and dating around again. In a way, this was very cathartic for me, a release of some sorts to watch this character (who acts, thinks, and is kinda like me) going thru the same difficult realizations and discussions. I'm Asian too, so this was doubly effective. I honestly really enjoyed this game, and it's one of the better games I've played this year.

The game starts you with three attributes, with one main one based on a questionaire you do at the beginning. As you level up you can put points into them and they also increase as you pick dialogue options in conversations. You also have the basic stats that go up the more you use them like attack and defense. I thought these were some decent RPG mechanics overall and I liked engaging with them.

The combat is very much like Persona where you have to target enemies weaknesses by taunting them like making them angry as an example, and then using abillties that target that weakness type for maximum damage. Also as you defeat the exes, you can do side missions for them afterwards and unlock them as summons in battle which I thought was cool. I also liked how you couldn't use certain summons in certain fights based on that exes story ties to the enemy you were fighting. Just small attention to detail that I liked.

The story was easily the best part though! What I like is that they don't present Jala as some kind of Mary Sue with no flaws, as they make it clear to you from the beginning that she has made a lot of mistakes in the past, and your choices will effect her path to redemption. I thought all of the dialogue was great and its all voiced which was surprise for a smaller game like this, but very appreciated as it makes the game easier to get invested in. The characters are all just teeming with great energy and it was blast to interact with all of them. They also do a great job of repersenting gay characters which is always nice to see in a video game in my book! The ending I also thought was very good and fitting for everything that the story was building up to.

The only part of the story I found a little disappointing was the side plot involving the towns teenagers being groomed by a cult leader. The game builds it up like your going to take this guy down, and I always love me some cult take downs in video games, but the ending to it was VERY anti-climatic. I don't know if this was based on choices I made in dialogue that lead to the ending I got, or if there even is another ending get. I couldn't really check as of the writing of this review, I couldn't find any real guides or walkthroughs to check if I did something wrong. They do bring it up again at the end of the game, so I don't know if thats sequel bait or something. I will be disappionted if it is, not that I wouldn't want another game from this team, but that I would have to play a second game to get a proper resolution.

reviews.title: Sans être un jeu bâclé, difficile de le recommander.

reviewText.content:
Aventure narrative, genre dont je suis pourtant bon client, The Mooseman se base des légendes russes.

Malheureusement le jeu est très court et en même temps très redondant et trop passif dans son gameplay : on marche vers la droite, avec une touche on active parfois une fonctionnalité "masque spirituel" pour modifier l'affichage, qq énigmes, ... le rythme global est très mou, très lent, vite ennuyeux.

L'histoire est racontée via des écrans de texte blanc sur fond noir, avec un contenu poético-poétique hyper cryptique, sans aucune illustration, ce qui la rend particulièrement indigeste si on essaye de la suivre.
Et la VO qui l'accompagne, une lecture du texte en russe uniquement, est très plate, ce qui n'aide pas.

Le support manette est partiel donc à jouer plutôt avec le clavier, la DA est sympa et rend de belles captures d'écran, mais les animations très basiques viennent tempérer le ressenti.

En positif il y a la documentation comme sur un jeu Arte du folklore qui sert de base au jeu, et les sous titres français, peu de langues étant présentes.

On a donc un côté "mon premier jeu", à voir les futures réalisations du studio.
dope af and muist get good at game, highly recommned if you love competitive games

An awesome game with a lot to offer, many different legends to play and once you learn a weapon you can confidently play other legends that share the same weapon, only need to adapt to Stats in terms of Speed and Dexterity, the servers are great and no too many issues with connectivity.

It has huge player base and an active dev team with a very big eSport scene that is healthy and enjoyable to watch, and it's skins and color selection makes it an awesome experience for people who like to express themselves.

The gameplay is smooth and fairly balanced with many stages and many cross over skins, this game couldn't be more perfect for Platform Fighters enjoyers!!!
Very good game, I like to play the game. Very good construcion, and very nice details.

reviews.title: A game for those who enjoy 2d fighting

reviewText.content: It's fun with friends, it can be difficult at first but after a while playing you can improve your skills.
Very fun game with friends its 100% better than playing this game alone

SteamWorld Dig 2 is a perfect sequel to this Metroidvania series. It takes everything the first game was and improves on it while adding some neat bells and whistles to the formula all it's own.

First of all the game is just gorgeous with this really interesting painterly art style. Big bold colors and fun shapes are used everywhere. It all perfectly sells the town of El Machino, the incredibly detailed main hub (including it's denizens) of this adventure.

It picks up where the first game ended and you're playing as Dorothy searching for Rusty, the previous main character, who vanished at the end of 1. The game breadcrumbs you story bits every now and then to keep you intrigued and wanting to further dig up this mystery. The story was kind of bare bones in the first one so I'm surprised they cared enough to expand it but I'm glad they did.

Don't let the extra care to the story fool you though, the main draw here is still the core loop from the first game. That being to dig up as much ore as you can carry, haul it to the top, and sell it to kit yourself out with upgrades that will let you carry even more and mine even further. Along your descent you'll find challenge rooms that will test your ability and reward you with various treasures, upgrade stations, and a new resource: cogs.

Cogs are one of my favorite additions to this game that adds a lot of depth and replay value. As you naturally upgrade your gear to be more effective you'll also unlock optional mods. That's where the cogs come in. Some mods cost 1, 2, or more to activate but they're not permanent. If you find that a mod isn't useful anymore and want to spend upgrade cogs elsewhere, you can slot them out and put them in the new thing. This essentially gives you total control of your play style and the freedom to experiment. You never have to worry if a weird upgrade will ruin the experience for you, just take your cogs elsewhere.

There are some great additions to your arsenal and gear that I don't want to spoil, just know that the developers keep things fresh and the gameplay ever evolving. There's always a new upgrade to learn, a secret to find, a challenge room to conquer.

The level design is in top form too. With all the options the game gives you it kind of has to be and they don't let things go to waste. There are some levels I'm never going to be able to forget and I'd reckon you won't be able to either.

All in all SteamWorld Dig 2 is one of the best Metroidvania titles I've ever played and I urge you to try it yourself if you like the genre. I'm surprised they gave this away for free. From the goofy steampunk western setting to the gorgeous artwork and the addictive gameplay you're spoiled for choice at finding something to like here. As for me, I eagerly await SteamWorld Dig 3 but I bought the spin-off SteamWorld Heist to tide me over.
