Donc bon petit jeu, mais à la durée de vie courte et sans replay value (~5h), à acheter en solde.

reviews.title: timmykimmel's review of You Suck at Parking

reviewText.content:
As a train traveller, I should really already be asking myself what I actually expected to find here. The passion of so many people to indulge in the hustle and bustle of city traffic with the tin can has always seemed rather irrational to me, but in a country where a car isn't simply a 'car' but a 'Volkswagen', I'm more of an alien as a bicycle rider.
Be that as it may - because of the enthusiasm for 'Re-Volt' and 'Trackmania', I didn't flinch for long - and the authors have really watched 'Speed' a few too many times. The game is crazy hectic, but the idea to develop such an ironic game concept out of the so often horrible driving physics of arcade racers, this is kind of charming. Only, in contrast to the virtual trip to the Nürburgring, I find that parking on the screen doesn't bring more joy than in a German city center. Respawn every 20 seconds, mines and heating rods at every corner, standstill is death - a game flow can't arise. If you still like it, please do.
We learn early on that features are still being worked on diligently. I might have shown mercy in Early Access, but if this is the release, I simply can't recommend it.
Excelent game, the atmosphere is incredible, the combat gameplay is perfect and easy to control, and the history is great.

One of the greatest games ever made. This Arkham trilogy that Rocksteady made, along with Origins revolutionized the genre of superhero games and set up a new standard, first big game inspired by them being the PS4 Spiderman game from 2018 and hopefully more to come.

"Hey, what if we made Arkham Asylum, but with a weaker story, less atmosphere, and a bundle of problems getting around an obnoxious overworld so we can pass this off as an open world game?"
"Will we have better boss fights so people don't complain about the one problem in an otherwise near-perfect game like last time?"
"Yeah, sure."
"Great!"

Boring game. Although it had positive rating on steam, the game was really boring. The city (environment) is not impressive at all. Fighting is completelly messed up, just press the buttons and batman will do. the skill tree is not clear. The optional missions too many and too messed up. You start to do an optional mission but you cant finish it if you dont get further with the main story. riddler missions too many and too hard. HUD and equipment could be better, only the story was OK.

Arkham City is a true continuation of Arkham Asylum, following the same art-style, characters, combat, and adding new elements to these things. The result is very good, and the game feels like a sequel, but also stands on its own. The main new feature is the ability to do side missions (which are not limited to Riddler's trophies), but the game is not a true open-world experience: it is still very linear. If you are a fan of Arkham Asylum, you will be a fan of Arkham City.

reviews.title: wintr7668's review of Batman: Arkham City

reviewText.content: It makes you feel like Batman. best story. best gameplay. i had a good time playing it.

reviews.title: it_is_arturo's review of Batman: Arkham City

reviewText.content: Ultimately; a game that has not aged particularly well. The visuals and atmosphere still holds up, but this is bogged down by finicky combat mechanics and stealth that suffers from similar complaints as the Assassin's Creeds of the time - fighting with the environment. I found the exploration and puzzles to be more enjoyable than the main storyline, but the further the game advanced, the more I wanted it to be over. There is also a plethora of gadgets that end up cluttering the directional buttons in a confusing amalgam. It is not always clear when to use what, destroying any sense of intuition. The waypoint system is also tiresome, with the way to progress not being obvious. I'm a fan of exploration, but with such vertical span allowed to the player character it is easy to lose yourself.
The game is kinda good, feels very fun at the beginning but when you reach a certain point, the game starts to be kinda repetitive and you feel bored of playing

This game could better by doing simple changes. The game is infested by bots, third party in-game currency sellers and cheaters which destroys legit players experience. By implemented simple changes, such as, changing the way their economy work by implementing a auction house instead of a open market with every item and currency being tradable like it is at the moment. This would stop the bot and increase the in-game item value. I understand that this probably is hard to do since the top players are all in with these cheats, but making this change will show the community that Gamigo group is willing to change and take their name out of the dirt like it is at the moment.
We played this one on the PS4 and absolutely LOVED IT!!  It is a great 4 player split-screen local game with awesome upgrades on all weapons.

Un grandioso RPG con un hermosa ambientación y personajes entrañables. Si bien se sale del esquema por turnos del JRPG tradicional, el sistema de combate bebe de entregas anteriores de la saga y las evoluciona con el uso de los Blades. Con las misiones secundarias y el contenido adicional, tenemos más de 100 horas de gameplay esperando por nosotros en Alrest.

A chill but challenging platformer, with great music and a simple, relaxing aesthetic. Philosophical, but dont expect any accurate astrology. Didn't quite hit the same notes as Thomas Was Alone for me, but still inkeeping with the style of minimalist objects with surprisingly deep characters. The twist of how they change the levels in your second playthough was very clever and well implemented. Well worth the price. A must play for fans of indie games and platformers alike.

Generally liked the game expect the story ending is not so well.

SPOILER ALERT!

During the most of the time you build relationship with Delilah to just say bye on the end??

Upon buying this game, i had NO idea about it except for the 'cool' art style, and to be honest.....
I WAS BLOWN AWAY.
First off, Pros:
+Amazing voice overs
+Cool soundtrack and sound design
+ Cartoony art style
+ atmospheric with their story

Cons:
- Anti-Climatic Ending
- FPS Drops (I cant really talk about that [Laptop Skrub] but other people were having little issues)

It was originally a 8.5-9 / 10 UNTIL I found these VERY useful in finding what happened
Amazing looking game, with a compelling storyline! Hard to put away once you started.

Отличная бродилка. Мы играем за лесного пожарного, нам предстоит очень интересное приключение, красивые пейзажи, душевные разговоры с напарницей - Делайлой, но все ли так хорошо? Нет. К сожалению, концовка игры была слита, а так игра очень хороша.
I really like the game but the ending is insufficient for me.
A hidden little gem with minimalistic graphics, lots of memorable dialogues and an overwhelming feeling of nostalgia.

Incredible game. I picked it up a few weeks after release back in 2016 with no expectations and was thoroughly surprised. The world is beautiful and the story is engaging and interesting. This game has really ruined me as I have been searching for years for something that can make me feel like it did.

The premise and style were almost ideal for me, until two things happened: I realized how tough navigation is (although I have to praise the analog approach to it), and how restricted and focused the level design is. As you play through it, you have mixed emotions of frustration and awe, because the story and relationship building is top notch. I still recommend playing this, but if you are a fan of modern games when you are spoiled by easy navigation of the world, it's probably better to watch a play-through, as the story is still worth it.

Besides the pretty visual and the "indie hype" around Firewatch i didn't really know much about it, As i found out it's very much an emotional journey, the intro scene is deep, heavy and sad.. putting a lot of the weight on the protagonist from the get go. It's almost difficult to digest in that way, but it does a great job at putting you in the shoes of your character by connecting with him.

Gameplay wise, well it's a walking simulator so to speak, there's isn't a lot of gameplay mechanic beyond orienting yourself and selecting dialog trees via your radio (which is great!). Early on in the game i decided to turn off the map markers, which i'm very glad i did! turns what would be a minimal gameplay mechanic is a pure treasure of orienting yourself in the wild, just with a map and a compas, i had a lot of fun of just figuring out where to go solely based on radio instructions alone, highly recommended!

The visuals may not be realistic but this very much acts like a tourism post card for Wyoming, and i would argue that the graphic style would help making the game a long lasting gem many years from now still.

irewatch меня действительно пробрал, я пролетел его за вечер, а потом долго думал о том насколько важны в жизни случайности и как много в ней несправедливости; живёшь, строишь планы, предполагаешь, как встретишь старость и вырастишь детей, а нет, у судьбы на тебя другие планы. В очередной раз убеждаюсь, что предполагаемые реальные истории в интерактивных новеллах самый сильный жанр в плане эмоциональности. Сотрудники Campo Santo раньше трудились над играми Telltale? с их мнимым выбором, а сами создали качественную историю, развивающуюся по канонам триллера, и заканчивающуюся двумя финалами, оба из которых дают ответ на главный вопрос - смогли ли главные герои пережить свои потери и заплатить за свои ошибки. Об этом мало кто говорит, но на самом деле в новелле три основных действующих персонажа, со своими скелетами в шкафу и каждый из них бежал от себя пока Йеллоустонский пожар 1988 года не стёр их следы. Мощная игра, о которой стоит сложить своё мнение - от меня 8.5
An atmospheric game away from the fast-paced mainstream. I'm really pleased that there's a brief history of how the character you're playing came to this unusual, reclusive profession.
Amazing looking game, with a compelling storyline! Hard to put away once you started.

J'aime bien, les choix étaient fort cool et te donnes l'impression d'avoir un réel impact, même si au final pas tant que ça bahahaha. Delilah bon, euh mitigé face a cette connasse, elle était drôle 30sec et après elle était relou à poser trop de questions là oh
Le côté un peu monde ouvert, genre t'as quand même la liberté de visiter la forêt et tout c'est trop cool, t'es pas troooop bloqué dans un bail linéaire, tiptop
im playing this to wasting my time before im i sleep, but after im playing  this game i cant sleep lol
Good. Gleb the fireman rated the game as a decent adventure game.

I liked the main characters of Henry and Deliah as there chemistry felt very believable and the voice acting was top notch. The story sets up a weird mystery which had me intrigued as to what was going on. The reveal though just felt really underwhelming to me. It made sense in the context of the story, but I was expecting something a lot more interesting.

Gameplay wise, its a walking sim with some light immersive sim elements. It played fine but I found navigating the map to be a bit annoying at times. The game is also really beautiul in terms of its lighting and enviroments.

Une belle aventure narrative. A la façon d'EdithFinch ou autre jeu du genre, on avance dans l'histoire en faisant différentes actions la plupart du temps trop simples pour parler d'énigmes.
L'intérêt du jeu est porté par l'histoire et surtout par le dialogue entre notre personnage et sa 'chef/collègue' via des talkies walkies : les dialogues (à choix multiple) sont très bien écrits et hyper bien interprétés par les acteurs, c'est la grosse force du jeu.
L'histoire et son intrigue permettent de garde l'intérêt éveillé durant les 5h/10h de jeu, sans temps creux.
Les décors sans être foufous sont très propres et cohérents avec le jeu et son ambiance.
A noté un petit message écolo en fond, sur la préservation de la nature, mais rien de lourdingue.

Joué sur SeriesX via le game pass

reviews.title: kodabgames's review of Potato Flowers in Full Bloom

reviewText.content: This game is seriously charming and features a great battle system that slowly unfolds just how deep and strategic it can actually be. The game wants you to mix and match groups of classes and experiment with different combinations. Its short and can be difficult in spots and I really want more classes, but the game delivers what it promises and doesn't outstay its welcome.

A fox trying to find her missing family and a son reconnecting with his estranged father blend together in this lovely and unforgettable story as you journey through the magnificent world towards The First Tree. 

Players take control of a fox as she journeys towards the source of life while you, the player, learn more about the relationship between father and son from the narrator by finding artifacts from his life interspersed within the world.  The story and the artwork are amazing in this short game and, when added with the music, made for a memorable experience.

The game encourages you to explore while learning more about the two stories that intersect on several different levels.  Uncovering artifacts, easily noticeable in the game, ensures that the story progresses.  The achievements are mostly easy to get and, for the most part, are part of the story.  Getting all the achievements will require a bit of work but worth it in the end.  Light puzzle solving and interesting platforming completes the game.

I found The First Tree to be enjoyable, heart touching, and mesmerizing as I explored both tales within a beautifully created world.  I recommend this game for those that like good stories, exploration, and beautiful artwork.

beautiful game, decent concept, mediocre execution.  Please be warned, that this IS a "walking sim" with some puzzle elements and not an RPG or true "fox sim" (in that one is merely running and jumping, not hunting, eating, drinking, or surviving).  This game could have been something like a terrestrial Abzu but falls VERY short of that magnificent work of art.  The game is basically a walking-sim with seemingly unrelated (to the gameplay) dialogue between a couple who have recently experienced great loss as the male narrator describes different aspects of his difficult growing-up and overall life. This game would be good (its not bad, but it certainly isn't good) if the level design better matched the gameplay intention of the developer in that i imagine the game is supposed to be relatively easy and relaxing but instead can be very tedious and frustrating due to poor level design and lackluster controls.

Portée sur le deuil de son père, cette aventure narrative nous fait jouer un renard, où chaque avancée dans le jeu lancera un commentaire du narrateur sur sa vie et la relation avec son père décédé.
Le propos est simple et réalisé avec une certaines intimité qui est juste et n'en fait pas des tonnes.
Le gameplay est également simple : on avance jusqu'au bout du niveau, on cherche des objets enterrés (clairement indiqués) pour avoir des compléments narratifs, quelques passages de plateforme, ...
Attention pour les chasseurs de succès : ils demanderont du temps (récupérer toutes les étoiles, trouver le roi des lapins, ...)
Pour ceux qui veulent simplement faire l'histoire (comme moi), le jeu même en fouillant un peu partout se termine en environ 2h donc est court.

Joué sur SeriesX en mode rétrocompatibilité, aucun bug rencontré.

𝟖,𝟓/𝟏𝟎 👏 𝐀 𝐅𝐔𝐋𝐋-𝐅𝐋𝐄𝐃𝐆𝐄𝐃 𝐒𝐓𝐀𝐍𝐃𝐀𝐋𝐎𝐍𝐄 𝐏𝐑𝐄𝐐𝐔𝐄𝐋
When I saw the first trailer with rhythm platforming, more faded visual, as it seemed to me then, also with bad designs of the main characters and the poster of the game, I was extremely skeptical, I was expecting just a average indie, an additional story for fans at a maximum of 7/10, apparently, most players and critics took the game that way,
But I immediately saw something more in it,
Mile 0 - is an example of an ideal Prequel, a small local masterpiece, the same gameplay, the same great visual, but an absolutely self-sufficient story that will suit even those who didn`t play the original, at the same time it perfectly complements it and does not spoil the original story in any way,
This game doesn`t have a "roguelike" unique concept of the original, where each player will have their own walkthrough and their own order of story scenes, there is no atmosphere of travel, So what? This is a different game, it shouldn`t copy the approach of the original, but at the same time it retained the features of the source, the world here consists of 3 large locations, in each of which a small plot scene awaits us, the choice of which location to go first and which one to go to second and third - depends on you,
for me, "Zero Mile" is a full-fledged original product, a continuation at the level of the original, with not so much replay value, but with its own "completely different" atmosphere, the sunny life of the minister's daughter next to the dictator's palace, and the game has a powerful competent ending, which is very lacking in the orig. Road 96,
People also complain that the decisions don’t really affect on something? C`mon, it was the same in the original, I believe that it`s enough for decisions in games to create the illusion of choice, it`s impossible to write several high-quality scenarios in 1 game, one but exciting is better, after all, the games are a scripted attractions for a couple of hours. At the same time, M0 has its own new choice system, where you must balance between 2 points of view in order to be able to make any decision in the final, there are 4 endings, by the way.

I already see that I`ll be in the minority, I thought a lot about lowering the rating, but I can’t, my conscience just won’t allow me, I dived into an unreal atmosphere, laughed at cool dialogues, got into the story and ending based on the friendship of 2 characters, while all the characters in the game are made very interesting, Dixiart has some talent for this, this is the first story game in..how many.. 2 years, probably? people, what's wrong with you, even AAA is now coming out with a disregard for it, story-driven games simply don`t exis, they have died out,
and here is a completed competent story, yes, I didn’t really like the roller/skate`s sections, but there are few of it, they serve more as a background mini-game, the concept is correct, it was made for emotional release, and in order not to have to draw too complicated cutscenes, but they could be better, for this you can really take away 0.5-1 points, but the 2nd rhythm game, about running away from Adam, is very funny, it’s a pity, the rest of the "races" are not like that.
You will also find a couple of new cool tracks here, you will find soul-warming references to the original, Mile 0 just "made my day", it will definitely become my contender for the best game of the year, despite the disappointments of some fans and gameplay-minded critics.

😊Subscribe on my Steam`s Curator`s page: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41977550/
///
Увидев первый трейлер с ритм-платформингом, как-будто ставшим более тусклым визуалом, и, такими себе дизайнами главных персонажей и постера игры, я был настроен крайне скептично, ожидал просто скромненькой индюшки, дополнительной истории для фанатов на максимум 7/10, видимо, большинство игроков и критиков именно так и восприняли игру,
Но я сразу разглядел в этом нечто большее,
Mile 0 - это пример идеального Приквела, маленький локальный шедевр, тот же геймплей, тот же шикарный визуал, но абсолютно самодостаточная история, которая подойдёт и тем, кто не проходил оригинал, в тоже время она прекрасно дополняет оригинальный сюжет и никак не портит первоначальную историю,
В этой игре нет немного"рогаликовой" уникальной концепции оригинала, где у каждого игрока будет своё прохождение и свой порядок сюжетных сцен, тут нету атмосферы путешествия, ну и что? Это другая игра, она не должна копировать подход оригинала, но при этом она сохранила черты первоисточника, мир тут состоит из 3 больших локаций, в каждой их которых нас ждёт небольшая сюжетная сцена, выбрать в какую локацию идти в первую очередь, а в какую во вторую и третью - лежит за вами,
для меня "Нулевая Миля" является полноценным самобытным продуктом, продолжением на уровне оригинала, с не такой большой реиграбельностью, зато со своей "совсем другой" атмосферой, солнечной жизни дочки министра рядом с дворцом диктатора, зато игра имеет мощную грамотную концовку, чего очень не хвататало оригинальной Дороге,
Также жалуются на то, что решения особо ни на что не влияют? Кмон, так было и в оригинале, я считаю, что решениям в играх достаточно создавать иллюзию выбора, невозможно прописать несколько качественных сценариев в игре, лучше один - зато захватывающий, всё-таки игра - это заскриптованный аттракцион на пару часов. При этом Mile 0 имеет свою новую систему выборов, где вы должны балансировать между 2-мя точками зрениям, чтобы иметь возможность принять любое решение в финале, концовок тут аж 4, кстати.

Я уже вижу, что буду в меньшинстве, я много думал над тем, чтобы понизить оценку, но я не могу, просто совесть не позволяет, я погрузился в нереальную атмосферу, смеялся с прикольных диалогов, проникся сюжетом и концовкой, основанной на дружбе 2 персонажей, при этом все персонажи игры сделаны очень интересно, у Dixiart какой-то талант к этому, это первая сюжетная игра за сколько, года за 2, наверное, люди, что с вами не так, даже AAA сейчас выходит со наплевательским отношением к истории, сюжетно-ориентированных игр просто нет, они вымерли,
а тут законченная грамотная история, да, покатушки на роликах мне не очень понравились, но их мало, они больше служат фоновой мини-игрой, концепция правильная, оно сделано для эмоциональной разрядки, и чтобы не надо было рисовать слишком сложные катсцены, но могли и получше, за это действительно можно отнять 0,5-1 балла, при этом 2-ая ритм-игра, про убегание от Адама, нереально забавная, но жаль, остальные "заезды" более проходные,
вы также найдёте тут пару новых классных треков, вы найдёте греющие душу отсылочки на оригинал, Mile 0 просто "сделала мой день", она однозначно станет моим претендентом на лучшую игру года, чтобы про неё не писали почему-то разочаровавшиеся фанаты и геймплея-нутые критики.

reviews.title: amsandor's review of In Other Waters

reviewText.content:
A fantastic exploration/narrative adventure - you play a scientist following the trail of her old mentor, who stumbles upon alien life in the oceans of an alien world. As you explore, you catalogue species, follow the trail of your mentor, and unravel a mystery in the depths of the alien ocean. You navigate through a map/radar system, and primarily interact with the game through a series of tools you have in your dive suit. Although the game is non-violent, it does have a resource management side, where you use gathered specimens to not only study, but fuel your oxygen and power cells in your suit. Past that, the game is largely story driven. 

And what a story! This game was thrilling in my mind - an excellent encapsulation of the mysterious and wonderous genre of science fiction. The style and music were also hypnotic, making the game a treat to interact with. A few small nagging annoyances exist - backtracking occurs, which in of itself is not always an issue, but in this case can be onerous due to the lack of mini-map when you are diving, making obtaining those precious specimens tedious at times, as you try and find your way to areas you missed on your first pass, without a map HUD. Sure, markers you haven't been to are coloured differently than those already tread, but that doesn't help when you backtrack. This was a minor annoyance, but certainly detracted from my overall enjoyment. 

Past that small complaint, and amazing adventure awaits in this title, and should be of interest to those who enjoy smaller, narrative adventures, science focused exploration, and a chill but engaging ocean going experience.

One of the games that are amazing to watch rather than play. Most of the story feels forced, as you get into situations that work as fluffy filler in between scenes. It seems that the game was crafted as a world-first before the story. I so much wish that authors followed one of the very known guidelines when making the story - starting writing it from the end going towards the beginning. This way you've felt that the perfectly crafted world will not be enough for the whole story. It has a love triangle and it's pretty messed up, yet the best possible ending somehow doesn't feel like the best. It's worth experiencing, but I'm not sure if playing it is the best option here.

reviews.title: Même qualités et défauts que le premier épisode

reviewText.content:
Même qualités et défauts que le premier épisode : graphiquement une vraie touche artistique, humour second degré bien senti, bons doublages (VO), durée de vie honnete, mais certaines énigmes improbables (heureusement il y en a peu dans ce cas, et moins que dans le 1er épisode).
L'histoire avance et est toujours aussi sympa, ça donne envie de continuer cette aventure :)

Great fun, I never played any of the original megaman games, maybe some inspired flash versions back on kongregate but this game slaps. It's not easy either, just like what i hear the other games to be. I played on easy because i wasn't looking for a hard experience and i still died during the levels a few times

Taking place in a polluted dystopian city where the workers of a soft drink corporation that also happens to be the city's monopoly are protesting for the death of the corporation's mascot due to an accident, you get to play as a "tagger" (graffiti artist) who in search of cool spots to spray their tag on, gets to decide his or the city's fate.
I have to say, although nothing too spectacular in terms of mechanics or story, it was a very fun experience. The '90s street style aesthetic is spot on and adds to the experience, despite disabling the VHS graphics filter towards the end. The city is "static", with NPCs in certain spots telling you part of the story or giving you hints on where to look next. I usually dislike non-linearity in my games, but right here everything just clicked together without being told what to do next or where to go specifically.
If you like platformers, you should give this a go, although you won't miss a lot by not playing it.

Jugué cuando lo pusieron gratis temporalmente en Steam. La verdad es un gran juego, es muy divertido y desafiante. Al estar hecho para el cooperativo, jugarlo con amigos es genial. Además, conseguir el trabajo en equipo, no es complicado. De hecho, es un juego con una jugabilidad sencilla pero que puede complicarse realmente rápido.
Una de las mejores cosas que tiene es que es muy rejugable, cada nivel se genera proceduralmente (y cuentan con seeds como en Minecraft, por si te gusta alguna) y hay bastantes mejoras y estilos de juego que explorar. Desbloquearlo todo llevará bastante, depende de la habilidad de los jugadores.
En aspectos técnicos, es un juego de bajos requisitos que aún así se ve bonito (por la iluminación) y elegante en cierta manera. Por otra parte la música es buena, agradable, motivadora y pega mucho con el juego. Aparte cambia dependiendo del bioma y tiempo (noche, día) en el que te encuentres.
Lo que queda son detallitos, como los originales menús que tiene, las skins desbloqueables, el modo libre (que empiezas con el tren que quieras), etc. También, es un juego muy estable, no he encontrado bugs hasta el momento y tampoco ha habido problemas con los servidores. Lo único que creo que le falta es un modo que no sea Infinito, uno por niveles convencionales, que tengas que llegar a X metros con algún requisito para conseguir 3 estrellas y pasar al siguiente nivel.

Sinceramente, lo recomiendo mucho. Sin ninguna duda me lo compraré, porque durante este tiempo que he podido jugarlo gratuitamente me ha convencido y (en parte) enamorado. Pocos juegos me han dado este entretenimiento con amigos.

The game not open world as Elder Scrolls of Fallout games and story line is pretty linear. You can choose the order of the planets to explore and easily travel between them, but since there aren't many side quests there is usually no point of returning once the main quest part is done. Side quests, while few, blend in with a main story very well. 
Environments are gorgeous, every planet has it's distinct look and feel - from endless deserts of Tatooine to forests of Kashyyyk.
Characters are likeable, the story is interesting, combat, though simple, but enjoyable. Character progression is very satisfying.

Overall it's a great game and probably one the the best rpg's of all time.

Très choupi sur la forme, mais avec des énigmes bien pensées et parfois pas si faciles que ca !
Globalement tout tourne autour des cartes et de l'assemblage des différents morceaux, avec un fil rouge conducteur qui fera passer par différents endroits/chapitres.
Les environnements et les énigmes sont variés, la difficulté progressive, le tout se joue de façon fluide sur une petite dizaine d'heures.
Une bonne surprise au final :)

(Joué sur SeriesX via Game Pass)

reviews.title: Simple, clever, cozy, and just challenging enough for any kind of gamer

reviewText.content:
Carto was a delightfully pleasant “cozy” adventure/puzzle game. The mechanic is clever and satisfying; you get to manipulate the real world by rearranging a map of it. The story gently tugs on the heart strings, and the characters are cute and fun to watch interact with one another.

Nothing in this game is deep, none of it is thought provoking, but I think that contributes to its charm. It’s the kind of game that can just be enjoyed.

The length of the game is perfect for casual players. There was only one part that became a bit of a grind for me, otherwise the pace was just right. I highly recommend this game to casual gamers who want something with a bit more to offer than your stereotypical casual game.

Pas d'objectif, pas de mission, juste une page blanche où ajoute des blocs de structure, le bloc unique en terme de sélection se transformant au fur et à mesure que la construction évolue et grossie.
Intéressant 5 mn, pour voir les structures qui sont générées en fonction des "cube de structure" qu'on ajoute/supprime.

Joué sur SeriesX via le game pass.

I see what the game is trying to do. To me personally, this is like a great fidget spinner, a relaxing scratch to an itch, a boredom killer, but nothing else. It's an experiment, not a game. I imagine it is awesome for children.

reviews.title: themediocritic's review of 12 is Better than 6

reviewText.content:
While the artistic choices and gameplay style are fun, neither are new or that refreshing to experience. I appreciate the effort in its action and gunplay but be prepared for the enemies to have better aim and pop-off shots rather quickly. It is challenging but not prohibitively so, and once you practice/play more, it should become far easier to progress. The violence and gore are also fabulous.

The story and transfer between maps/locations could have used some extra time in terms of being quality components of the game. They didn't help make the game flow well or seem pieced together in a meaningful or sensible way.

Enemies are too overzealous in their attempts to find you in that there isn't any strategy to their AI decisions: they hear you - they come toward you. That's it. It's that simple. It leads to them bulking up and then rushing and overwhelming you. 

It's not that I don't like 12 is Better Than 6; I simply don't think it does well in accomplishing its objectives in terms of game design during development. It's too repetitive and the story is too fragmented.

Fishing game with Eldridge horror is great combination. While fishing keeps you calm and interested, horror part takes you on the edge. Overall the world looks amazing. Animation of the waves is awesome. Here and there you can see whale or dolphins jumping out of the water. The ocean looks alive, but not overcrowded. Eldridge horror part delivers huge lovecraftian creatures, mysteries and ancient artifacts. Dredging and fishing mini-games are unobtrusive, are not too complex to be stuck on them, but they add a little bit of effort to each catch. Story is subtle and it isn't pushed right into the face. Overall this game is good experience.

reviews.title: A great game for those with thalassophobia

reviewText.content:
At first, I was a little confused about what to do, the game gives you freedom to explore this sea and the islands, but quickly I was extremely interested in this world.

Dredge uses the sea to give you the feeling that you're small compared to the majestic creatures deep down.

The game story is also interesting, quite predictable, but still good.

Another thing to mention is the user interface, it is the first game that I liked enough to write about it.

reviews.title: A unique, niche Lovecraftian-inspired fishing game

reviewText.content: I consider myself something of a fishing game enthusiast, my obsession with fishing games and fishing mini-games starting from the days of mobile fishing games. I enjoy the fishing mini-games in games like Fire Emblem Three Houses, since actual fishing games tend to not provide much story and stimulation.

You take the job of the town fisherman of a small island village and begin your work around the islands nearby. The job seems normal enough, but odd things begin to happen, especially at night.   Strange mists, rocks that appear out of nowhere, ghost ships, and even sea monsters appear out of the dark...and that’s not even counting the strange people you meet along the way.  An odd local man known only as ‘The Collector’ seems to be icing on the crazy cake, but as you gather strange items for the man things get even weirder and either your sanity or the fate of the world might just hang in the balance.

Dredge is a third-person fishing inventory management game with a generous helping of Lovecraftian horror thrown in for good measure.  Here you explore and fish the waters around a group of unique islands that hold many dark and disturbing secrets.  You will fight against time, inventory space, and panic as you explore around completing tasks for the mysterious Collector.  While doing these tasks you will want to take advantage of fishing spots so that you can sell the fish you catch to upgrade your boat with items like brighter lights, better nets, and more versatile fishing rods.  These upgrades are important and will be needed to complete other tasks and progress the game.

Dredge operates on a day-night cycle where the act of moving or fishing causes the time to move forward.  While it is usually fine to be out and about in the daytime, the true horrors habitually emerge at night. You must be careful as your sanity meter will drop when it is dark causing situations that can damage your ship or even sink it completely.  Resting at one of the docks in the game can help bring your sanity back down to normal where you can once again face the open water in relative peace.  

The game currently has one DLC, The Pale Reach, which is not needed to complete the game but adds a stand-alone story, more items to find, more fish to catch, and more achievements to the base game.

Achievements are relatively easy but may take some time to complete.  Some of the achievements are tied to the story so they are hard to miss but other achievements range from completing all the tasks given to you to finding every type of fish in the game.  Additionally, Dredge offers two alternate endings, each with their own achievement, and both are easy to get.  In all, the achievements for this game are attainable with effort but still enjoyable without feeling like a herculean task.

Dredge was easy to learn right off the bat, and it was quite enjoyable to explore the sights, get immersed in the story, and spend some time fishing.  The game is a mix of a cozy and Lovecraftian horror and I enjoyed my time fishing the horrifying waves and dredging up strange secrets.  Additionally, the art style and music had their own charm and appeal that helped make this short game quite memorable.  I recommend grabbing Dredge and fishing up strange and mysterious things from the terrifying depths yourself.

A very good game and cheap when part of a deal in the Playstation Store.

However, longevity is a real issue here — there are a few islands and I gave up before leaving the first one. It becomes a real drain and grind far too quickly.

There are some great parts though: The cars all feel different, burglarising properties never gets old, most missions are fairly interesting, police chases are fun, and physics are entertaining.

Despite all of this, it still achieves a 6/10 for me — there's just nothing pulling me further into the game.

reviews.title: griha24's review of LEGO Marvel Super Heroes

reviewText.content:
𝟕,𝟑/𝟏𝟎
Of course, this part cannot be called a reskin of other lego games, but nevertheless it is part of big conveyor and I can’t rate it higher.
The product copes with the task of transferring Marvel universe to the Lego format (Lego Spider-Man is 10/10), here the characters fights differently, the key characters have radically different abilities (very bad controls in flight), the plot is independent, but, firstly, in many places he copies films, and secondly, he is simply boring, of the memorable levels .. out of 15, I remember only 3.
Children or Marvel fans will like the game, there is even a good open world, this is really a large, small part of New York where you can fly, drive, there is a very pleasant atmosphere, but the side quests are as simple as possible, straight 3+ age
There are also additional story missions from Deadpool, many of which are unlocked for a huge amount of gold blocks, which, of course, is mockery farming. As for the characters, there are a lot of them and most often they are just reskins, for example, Wolverine generally has the face of John Jameson) I would prefer that there were 30 characters in the game, but that all of them should be unique, but I must admit that here there are enough interesting special heroes, but as a percentage of the total number of figures available in the game, this, of course, units. I also should note that the game is incredibly buggy, the characters are constantly getting stuck somewhere, so even technically the conveyor of lego games is not perfect, on new systems the game also crashes very often.

Subscribe on my Steam Curators page:
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41977550/

You can tell the developers knew what they were doing from the very beginning of the gameplay. Well-designed UI, full-emotion VO, player character customization, funny storytelling and dialogs, highly detailed backgrounds, and pretty character animation bring us a high-quality visual novel experience. The attribute system combines the options that are distinguished enough, which makes the players believe they can build their own story path or personality.

reviews.title: griha24's review of Fashion Police Squad

reviewText.content:
𝟕,𝟑/𝟏𝟎 🍹 𝐁𝐨𝐨𝐦𝐞𝐫 𝐬𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡 𝐢𝐭𝐬 𝐨𝐰𝐧 𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐤 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐟𝐮𝐧 𝐩𝐥𝐨𝐭

Perhaps the best game in the retro shooter genre, which, unlike some "Ion Fury", isn`t a thoroughbred copy of the old formula, but offers a lot of its own gaming solutions, but at the same time, it is lame in its main task. So, let's go point by point, the authors came up with a very entertaining concept of the "Fashion Police" in itself, running after dull-dressed citizens, and helping them adjust their taste preferences in the right direction, with the help of paint and sewing guns. Despite the uniformity of tasks, such as "go and clean up the area", the game has a general plot, it is, of course, as "thrashy" and simple as possible, but its very presence in this genre already adds a few points to the game from me personally, and at least a couple of times, the game will make you smile. There is no lgbt+ agenda in story, it iss only in our most "fashionable" main character and a maximum of a couple of little things. Well, now about the most important thing, why in the gameplay of the game everything did not work out so well, the fact is that 6-10 hours of play can be both an incredible buzz for you and a "burning ass" mixed with a buzz, as it turned out for me personally, so I would advise you to play in general on easy difficulty, because, unfortunately, a small team of 3-4 people in their first game, alas, could not build the correct game design of the arenas, this is my main Complaint, which made me lower my final grade a bit, as much as I don't want it, Look, here we need a certain weapon to damage a certain enemy, at first you will have 2 guns, each has a main and an alternative fire, you will need to shoot at someone with the left button, at someone with the right, if you shoot the "wrong" cartridge, there will be no damage to the enemy at all, excluding 2 weapons, which already have nuances, but it given closer to the middle-end of the game, visually - this is, for example, dyeing the clothes of an office clerk or hemming a citizen in hanging clothes, And it's awesome! Such a system gives the gameplay a bit of "strategy", doesn`t allow you to walk with one weapon the whole game.. here, by the way, there are endless ammo,
different types of enemies spawn on the arena and the difficulty is to have time to switch to the right gun, BUT the locations themselves are not at all adapted to this,
most often these are very narrow rooms, where you can't even run in circles, sometimes the enemy spawns out in front of your face,even having prepared in advance, you are unlikely to dodge damage,
How, devs? In such a dynamic and "multi-layered" gameplay you lock the player in these fucking 1-meter boxes, some "mouse fuss" "on luck" turns out, you maded open street lanes at the beginning of the game, there were also squares, but most of the battles in the whole game takes place in small rooms, where 10 different bots spawn from all sides at the same time,
a banal increase in the size of the battle arenas would already partially solve the problem, there is also an enemy releasing a gas cloud in a huge area in front of him, it is very problematic to run away from several of these with 5 more enemies in the room,
or, for example, "electric scooters" rushing at you at an incredible speed, well, devs, make somewhere an opportunity to jump from them up to some small "tower", like on a beach location where you can climb on the cabins,
also defeated enemies do not completely disappear from the map and create additional inconvenience,
oh yes, we also have a local hook-cat here - a belt, on which we can fly up, but the "multistoried" gameplay in vertical space is practically not used here, a maximum of 2 "floors", and even they are quite rare,
yes, by the way, this is again a mechanic from Doom Eternal, which everyone uses now, but in the same "Shadow Warrior 3" and "Postal: Brain Damaged" the hook is used quite competently,
but here the Belt is also needed for small "parkour" sections, in general, the game has a lot of gameplay abstracted from the basics, which dilutes the standard formula well: Parkour sections with 2 types of platforming, 2 exciting sniper mini-games, 1 chase with a machine gun, mini-games between boss stages, these are the things I wanted even more than the main gameplay,
The bosses, by the way, are well balanced, they are moderately interesting, not hardcore, there will be checkpoints between the stages, I was pleased with the gameplay of the second boss, where you had to look for a suitable weapon while the boss was "stunned", And visually pleased with the third one, which throwing magic needles and scissors at you, and the first one is quite standard, like 3 side missions, by the way, which looks somehow "template" and "forced",
There is also an "UltA" - Style Glove, but you cannot "take" it with you to the next level, and it always accumulates at the scheduled moment of the level, at which the developers will spawn 15 bots at 1 point and you can hardly resist using a super attack for a couple of opponents at the end of the level, but there is also a little plot sense in using it.

I also want to separately praise the developers for the "water gun", shoot with a left button, then aim with the right button and have a strong pressure for alternative fire - this is perfect, it's perfect to shoot from it,
you can also spray "accelerating" water on the floor, which opens up the functionality for parkour and gives off strong vibes of the "Portal". And also thanks for the Russian. subtitles :)
In general, it turned out to be a good entertaining FPS, somewhat average, as, for example, in music, although it is quite "full of life" and fulfills its function, and the locations lack diversity (only city/beach/yacht), in some ways game awesome - in visuals, in concept and in some gameplay decisions, but also with a bunch of game design mistakes. I don’t particularly want to scold, but it's a pity that it didn't turn out better than it is, but the game will still definitely entered my top 2022, and I will wait for the 2nd FPS.

Subscribe on my Steam Curators page: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41977550/
/
Возможно лучшая игра в жанре ретро-шутера, которая, в отличие от какого-нибудь "Ion Fury", не является чистокровным копированием старой формулы, а предлагает множество своих геймплейных решений, но и в тоже время, хромает в выполнении своей основной задачи.
Итак, давайте по пунктам, авторы придумали саму по себе очень занимательную концепцию "Полиции моды", бегающую за уныло одетыми гражданами, и помогающую им скоректировать свои вкусовые предпочтения в правильном направлении, с помощью красковых и швейных пушек.
Несмотря на однотипность заданий, типо "сходи и зачисть район", общий сюжет у игры имеется, он, естественно, максимально "трешовенький" и простенький, но само его наличие в таком жанре уже добавляет немножко баллов лично от меня, да и хотя-бы пару раз, игра сможет вас улыбнуть,
никакой лгбт+ повестки в истории нет, она есть только в самом нашем "модном" главном персонаже и максимум ещё в паре мелочей.

Ну а теперь о самом важном, почему не получилось всё так гладко в геймплее игры, дело в том, что 6-10 часов игры могут стать для вас, как и невероятным кайфом, так и диким "жопогорением" вперемешку с кайфом, как получилось лично у меня, так что я посоветовал бы играть вообще на лёгкой сложности, так как, к сожалению, маленькая команда из 3-4 человек в своей первой игре, увы, но не смогла выстроить правильный геймдизайн арен, это моя главная претензия, заставившая меня немного понизить финальную оценку, как бы мне этого не хотелось,
Смотрите, тут у нас для урона определённому врагу нужно определённое оружие, поначалу у вас будет 2 пушки, у каждой есть основной и альтернативный огонь, в кого-то надо будет стрелять левой кнопкой, в кого-то правой, неправильный "патрон" не будет наносить дамаг, исключая 2 оружия, которое уже имеет нюансы, но даётся ближе к середине-концу игры, визуально - это, например, покрасить одежду офисному клерку или подшить гражданина в висячей одежде,
И это обалденно! Такая система придаёт немного "стратегии" геймплею, не позволяет вам ходить с одним оружием всю игру.. тут вообще, кстати, бесконечные патроны,
на аренке спаунятся разные виды врагов и сложность заключается в успевании переключаться на нужную пушку, НО сами локации вообще не приспособлены к этому,
чаще всего это очень узкие комнатки, где даже по кругу от врагов не пробежишься, иногда враг вообще вылезает у тебя перед лицом, ты даже заранее приготовившись, практически никак не сможешь увернуться от дамага,
Ну как вообще, разработчики? в таком динамичном и "многослойном" геймплее запирать игрока в эти грёбанные 1-метровые коробки, "мышинная возня" "чисто на лаки" какая-то получается, у вас же вначале игры были открытые уличные переулки, были и площади, но большинство битв во всей игре проходит в маленьких комнатках, где со всех сторон одновременно спаунятся по 10 разных ботов,
банальное увеличение размера боевых арен уже бы частично решило проблему, тут же есть ещё противник, выпускающий газовое облако в огромной площади впереди себя, убежать от нескольих таких с ещё и 5 врагами в комнате очень проблематично,
или, взять, например, "электросамокатчиков", летящих на тебя с невероятной скоростью, ну сделайте вы где-нибудь возможность подпрыгнуть от них на какую-нибудь небольшую вышку, вот как на пляжной локации, где можно было залезать на кабинки,
также побеждённым враги полностью не исчезают с карты и создают дополнительные неудобства,
ах да, у нас же тут есть ещё местный крюк-кошка - ремень, на котором мы можем подлетать, но "многоэтажный" геймплей в вертикальном пространстве практически не используется, максимум 2 "этажа", ито даже они довольно редки,
да, кстати, это опять механика из Дум Этернал, которую юзают все подряд сейчас, но в том же, "Shadow Warior 3" и "Postal: Brain Damaged" крюк используется достаточно грамотно,
но тут Ремень также нужен для небольших "паркурных" секций, вообще в игре много отвлечённого от основы геймплея, неплохо разбавляющую стандартную формулу: Паркур-секции с 2 видами платформинга, 2 увлекательных снайперских мини-игры, 1 погоня с пулемётом, мини-игры в перерывах между стадиями боссов, вот таких вещей хотелось даже больше основного геймплея,
Боссы, кстати, сбалансированы хорошо, они в меру интересные, не хардкорные, между стадиями будут чекпоинты, геймплейно меня порадовал второй босс, где надо было искать подходящее оружие, пока босс "застанен", а визуально порадовал третий, кидающийся магическими иголками и ножницами, а первый - достаточно стандартный, как и 3 сайд-миссии, кстати, выглядящими какими-то "шаблонными" и "вымученными",
Тут также есть "ульта" - Перчатка стиля, но её нельзя "забрать" с собой на следующий левел, а накапливается она всегда в запланированный момент уровня, в который разрабы наспаунят 15 ботов в 1 точке и врядли вы удержитесь придержать супер-атаку на пару противников в конце уровня, но зато в её использовании тоже есть небольшой сюжетный смысл.

Также отдельно хочу похвалить разработчиков за "водяную пушку", стрелять обычной струёй, чтобы потом нацелиться правой кнопкой и был сильный напор для альтернативного огня - вот это придумано идеально, стрелять из неё очень кайфово,
также "водянкой" можно распылять "ускоряющую" воду на пол, что открывает функционал к паркуру и отдаёт сильными вайбами "Портала". А ещё спасибо за рус. субтитры :)
В целом, получился хороший развлекательный FPS, в чём-то средний, как например, в музыке, хотя она достаточно задорная и свою функцию выполняет, да и локациям не хватает разнообразия (город/пляж/яхта), в чём-то офигенный, в визуале, концепции и некоторых геймплейных решениях, но и, также с кучей геймдизайнерских промахов. Ругать особо не хочу, но обидно за игру, которая однозначно вошла в мой топ 2022, буду ждать 2-ой ФПС.
